  118: suite() ->
  119:     [{ct_hooks,[ts_install_cth]},
  120:      {timetrap, {minutes, 9}}].

  123:     [spawn_with_binaries, t_exit_1, {group, t_exit_2},
  124:      trap_exit_badarg, trap_exit_badarg_in_bif,
  125:      bump_reductions, low_prio, yield, yield2, otp_4725,
  126:      dist_unlink_ack_exit_leak, bad_register, garbage_collect,
  127:      process_flag_badarg,
  128:      process_flag_fullsweep_after, process_flag_heap_size,
  129:      command_line_max_heap_size,
  130:      spawn_opt_heap_size, spawn_opt_max_heap_size,
  131:      spawn_huge_arglist,
  132:      otp_6237,
  133:      {group, spawn_request},
  134:      {group, process_info_bif},
  135:      {group, processes_bif},

  138:      {group, alias},

  142: groups() -> 
  143:     [{t_exit_2, [],

  202: 
  203: init_per_suite(Config) ->
  204:     A0 = case application:start(sasl) of
  205: 	     ok -> [sasl];
  206: 	     _ -> []
  207: 	 end,
  208:     A = case application:start(os_mon) of
  209: 	     ok -> [os_mon|A0];
  210: 	     _ -> A0
  211: 	 end,
  212:     [{started_apps, A}|Config].
  213: 
  214: end_per_suite(Config) ->
  215:     As = proplists:get_value(started_apps, Config),
  216:     lists:foreach(fun (A) -> application:stop(A) end, As),
  217:     catch erts_debug:set_internal_state(available_internal_state, false),
  218:     Config.
  219: 
  220: init_per_group(_GroupName, Config) ->
  221:     Config.
  222: 
  223: end_per_group(_GroupName, Config) ->
  224:     Config.
  225: 
  226: init_per_testcase(Func, Config)
  227:   when Func =:= processes_default_tab;
  228:        Func =:= processes_this_tab ->
  229:     case erlang:system_info(build_type) of
  230:         BT when BT =:= debug; BT =:= valgrind ->
  231:             {skip, "Don't run in debug/valgrind"};
  232:         _ ->
  233:             [{testcase, Func} | Config]
  234:     end;
  235: init_per_testcase(Func, Config) when is_atom(Func), is_list(Config) ->
  236:     [{testcase, Func}|Config].
  237: 
  238: end_per_testcase(Func, Config) when is_atom(Func), is_list(Config) ->
  239:     %% Restore max_heap_size to default value.
  240:     erlang:system_flag(max_heap_size,
  241:                        #{size => 0,
  242:                          kill => true,
  243:                          include_shared_binaries => false,
  244:                          error_logger => true}),
  245:     erts_test_utils:ept_check_leaked_nodes(Config).
  246: 
  247: fun_spawn(Fun) ->
  248:     spawn_link(erlang, apply, [Fun, []]).
  249: 
  250: %% Tests that binaries as arguments to spawn/3 doesn't leak
  251: %% (unclear if this test case will actually prove anything on
  252: %% a modern computer with lots of memory).
  253: spawn_with_binaries(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  254:     L = lists:duplicate(2048, 42),
  255:     TwoMeg = lists:duplicate(1024, L),
  256:     Fun = fun() -> spawn(?MODULE, binary_owner, [list_to_binary(TwoMeg)]),
  257: 			 receive after 1 -> ok end end,
  258:     Iter = case test_server:is_valgrind() of
  259: 		     true -> 10;
  260: 		     false -> 150
  261: 		 end,
  262:     test_server:do_times(Iter, Fun),
  263:     ok.
  264: 
  265: binary_owner(Bin) when is_binary(Bin) ->
  266:     ok.
  267: 
  268: %% Tests exit/1 with a big message.
  269: t_exit_1(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  270:     ct:timetrap({seconds, 20}),
  271:     start_spawner(),
  272:     process_flag(trap_exit, true),
  273:     test_server:do_times(10, fun t_exit_1/0),
  274:     stop_spawner(),
  275:     ok.
  276: 
  277: t_exit_1() ->
  278:     Pid = fun_spawn(fun() -> exit(kb_128()) end),
  279:     Garbage = kb_128(),
  280:     receive
  281: 	      {'EXIT', Pid, Garbage} -> ok
  282: 	  end.
  283: 
  284: 
  285: %% Tests exit/2 with a lot of data in the exit message.
  286: t_exit_2_other(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  287:     ct:timetrap({seconds, 20}),
  288:     start_spawner(),
  289:     process_flag(trap_exit, true),
  290:     test_server:do_times(10, fun t_exit_2_other/0),
  291:     stop_spawner(),
  292:     ok.
  293: 
  294: t_exit_2_other() ->
  295:     Pid = fun_spawn(fun() -> receive x -> ok end end),
  296:     Garbage = kb_128(),
  297:     exit(Pid, Garbage),
  298:     receive
  299: 	      {'EXIT', Pid, Garbage} -> ok
  300: 	  end.
  301: 
  302: %% Tests that exit(Pid, normal) does not kill another process.;
  303: t_exit_2_other_normal(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  304:     ct:timetrap({seconds, 20}),
  305:     process_flag(trap_exit, true),
  306:     Pid = fun_spawn(fun() -> receive x -> ok end end),
  307:     exit(Pid, normal),
  308:     receive
  309: 	      {'EXIT', Pid, Reason} ->
  310: 		  ct:fail({process_died, Reason})
  311: 	  after 1000 ->
  312: 		  ok
  313: 	  end,
  314:     case process_info(Pid) of
  315: 	      undefined ->
  316: 		  ct:fail(process_died_on_normal);
  317: 	      List when is_list(List) ->
  318: 		  ok
  319: 	  end,
  320:     exit(Pid, kill),
  321:     ok.
  322: 
  323: %% Tests that we can trap an exit message sent with exit/2 from
  324: %% the same process.
  325: self_exit(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  326:     ct:timetrap({seconds, 10}),
  327:     start_spawner(),
  328:     process_flag(trap_exit, true),
  329:     test_server:do_times(200, fun self_exit/0),
  330:     stop_spawner(),
  331:     ok.
  332: 
  333: self_exit() ->
  334:     Garbage = eight_kb(),
  335:     P = self(),
  336:     true = exit(P, Garbage),
  337:     receive
  338: 	      {'EXIT', P, Garbage} -> ok
  339: 	  end.
  340: 
  341: %% Tests exit(self(), normal) is equivalent to exit(normal) for a process
  342: %% that doesn't trap exits.
  343: normal_suicide_exit(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  344:     process_flag(trap_exit, true),
  345:     Pid = fun_spawn(fun() -> exit(self(), normal) end),
  346:     receive
  347: 	      {'EXIT', Pid, normal} -> ok;
  348: 	      Other -> ct:fail({bad_message, Other})
  349: 	  end.
  350: 
  351: %% Tests exit(self(), Term) is equivalent to exit(Term) for a process
  352: %% that doesn't trap exits.";
  353: abnormal_suicide_exit(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  354:     Garbage = eight_kb(),
  355:     process_flag(trap_exit, true),
  356:     Pid = fun_spawn(fun() -> exit(self(), Garbage) end),
  357:     receive
  358: 	      {'EXIT', Pid, Garbage} -> ok;
  359: 	      Other -> ct:fail({bad_message, Other})
  360: 	  end.
  361: 
  362: %% Tests that exit(self(), die) cannot be caught.
  363: t_exit_2_catch(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  364:     process_flag(trap_exit, true),
  365:     Pid = fun_spawn(fun() -> catch exit(self(), die) end),
  366:     receive
  367: 	      {'EXIT', Pid, normal} ->
  368: 		  ct:fail(catch_worked);
  369: 	      {'EXIT', Pid, die} ->
  370: 		  ok;
  371: 	      Other ->
  372: 		  ct:fail({bad_message, Other})
  373: 	  end.
  374: 
  375: %% Tests trapping of an 'EXIT' message generated by a bad argument to
  376: %% the abs/1 bif.  The 'EXIT' message will intentionally be very big.
  377: trap_exit_badarg(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  378:     ct:timetrap({seconds, 10}),
  379:     start_spawner(),
  380:     process_flag(trap_exit, true),
  381:     try
  382:         %% suppress  =ERROR REPORT=== emulator messages
  383:         ok = logger:add_primary_filter(suppress_log_spam, {
  384:             fun(#{meta := #{error_logger := #{emulator := true, tag := error}}}, _Report) ->
  385:                 stop;
  386:             (_Meta, _Report) ->
  387:                 ignore
  388:             end, ok}),
  389:         test_server:do_times(10, fun trap_exit_badarg/0),
  390:         ct:sleep(500) %% flush logging
  391:     after
  392:         ok = logger:remove_primary_filter(suppress_log_spam)
  393:     end,
  394:     stop_spawner(),
  395:     ok.
  396: 
  397: trap_exit_badarg() ->
  398:     Pid = fun_spawn(fun() -> bad_guy(kb_128()) end),
  399:     Garbage = kb_128(),
  400:     receive
  401: 	      {'EXIT',Pid,{badarg,[{erlang,abs,[Garbage],Loc1},
  402: 				   {?MODULE,bad_guy,1,Loc2}|_]}}
  403: 	      when is_list(Loc1), is_list(Loc2) ->
  404: 		  ok;
  405: 	      Other ->
  406: 		  ok = io:format("Bad EXIT message: ~P", [Other, 30]),
  407: 		  ct:fail(bad_exit_message)
  408: 	  end.
  409: 
  410: bad_guy(Arg) ->
  411:     abs(Arg).
  412: 
  413: 
  414: kb_128() ->
  415:     Eight = eight_kb(),
  416:     {big_binary(),
  417:      Eight, Eight, Eight, Eight, Eight, Eight, Eight, Eight,
  418:      big_binary(),
  419:      Eight, Eight, Eight, Eight, Eight, Eight, Eight, Eight,
  420:      big_binary()}.
  421: 
  422: eight_kb() ->
  423:     B64 = lists:seq(1, 64),
  424:     B512 = {<<1>>,B64,<<2,3>>,B64,make_unaligned_sub_binary(<<4,5,6,7,8,9>>),
  425: 		  B64,make_sub_binary([1,2,3,4,5,6]),
  426: 		  B64,make_sub_binary(lists:seq(1, ?heap_binary_size+1)),
  427: 		  B64,B64,B64,B64,big_binary()},
  428:     lists:duplicate(8, {B512,B512}).
  429: 
  430: big_binary() ->
  431:     big_binary(10, [42]).
  432: big_binary(0, Acc) ->
  433:     list_to_binary(Acc);
  434: big_binary(N, Acc) ->
  435:     big_binary(N-1, [Acc|Acc]).
  436: 
  437: %% Test receiving an EXIT message when spawning a BIF with bad arguments.
  438: trap_exit_badarg_in_bif(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  439:     ct:timetrap({seconds, 10}),
  440:     process_flag(trap_exit, true),
  441:     test_server:do_times(10, fun trap_exit_badarg_bif/0),
  442:     ok.
  443:     
  444: trap_exit_badarg_bif() ->
  445:     Pid = spawn_link(erlang, node, [1]),
  446:     receive
  447: 	      {'EXIT', Pid, {badarg, _}} ->
  448: 		  ok;
  449: 	      Other ->
  450: 		  ct:fail({unexpected, Other})
  451: 	  end.
  452: 
  453: %% The following sequences of events have crasched Beam.
  454: %%
  455: %% 1) An exit is sent to a process which is currently not running.
  456: %%    The exit reason will (on purpose) overwrite the message queue
  457: %%    pointer.
  458: %% 2) Before the process is scheduled in, it receives a timeout (from
  459: %%    a 'receive after').
  460: %% 3) The process will crash the next time it executes 'receive'.
  461: 
  462: exit_and_timeout(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  463:     ct:timetrap({seconds, 20}),
  464: 
  465:     process_flag(trap_exit, true),
  466:     Parent = self(),
  467:     Low = fun_spawn(fun() -> eat_low(Parent) end),
  468:     High = fun_spawn(fun() -> eat_high(Low) end),
  469:     eat_wait_for(Low, High),
  470:     ok.
  471: 
  472: 
  473: eat_wait_for(Low, High) ->
  474:     receive
  475: 	{'EXIT', Low, {you, are, dead}} ->
  476: 	    ok;
  477: 	{'EXIT', High, normal} ->
  478: 	    eat_wait_for(Low, High);
  479: 	Other ->
  480: 	    ct:fail({bad_message, Other})
  481:     end.
  482: 
  483: eat_low(_Parent) ->
  484:     receive
  485:     after 2500 ->
  486: 	    ok
  487:     end,
  488:     receive
  489: 	Any ->
  490: 	    io:format("Received: ~p\n", [Any])
  491:     after 1000 ->
  492: 	    ok
  493:     end.
  494:     
  495: eat_high(Low) ->
  496:     process_flag(priority, high),
  497:     receive after 1000 -> ok end,
  498:     exit(Low, {you, are, dead}),
  499:     loop(erlang:monotonic_time() + erlang:convert_time_unit(5,second,native)).
  500: 
  501: %% Busy loop for 5 seconds.
  502: 
  503: loop(StopTime) ->
  504:     case StopTime >= erlang:monotonic_time() of
  505: 	true -> ok;
  506: 	false -> loop(StopTime)
  507:     end.
  508: 
  509: 
  510: %% Tries to send two different exit messages to a process.
  511: %% (The second one should be ignored.)
  512: exit_twice(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  513:     ct:timetrap({seconds, 20}),
  514: 
  515:     process_flag(trap_exit, true),
  516:     Low = fun_spawn(fun etwice_low/0),
  517:     High = fun_spawn(fun() -> etwice_high(Low) end),
  518:     etwice_wait_for(Low, High),
  519:     ok.
  520: 
  521: etwice_wait_for(Low, High) ->
  522:     receive
  523: 	{'EXIT', Low, first} ->
  524: 	    ok;
  525: 	{'EXIT', Low, Other} ->
  526: 	    ct:fail({wrong_exit_reason, Other});
  527: 	{'EXIT', High, normal} ->
  528: 	    etwice_wait_for(Low, High);
  529: 	Other ->
  530: 	    ct:fail({bad_message, Other})
  531:     end.
  532: 
  533: etwice_low() ->
  534:     etwice_low().
  535: 
  536: etwice_high(Low) ->
  537:     process_flag(priority, high),
  538:     exit(Low, first),
  539:     exit(Low, second).
  540: 
  541: %% Tests the process_info/2 BIF.
  542: t_process_info(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  543:     [] = process_info(self(), registered_name),
  544:     register(my_name, self()),
  545:     {registered_name, my_name} = process_info(self(), registered_name),
  546:     {status, running} = process_info(self(), status),
  547:     {min_heap_size, 233} = process_info(self(), min_heap_size),
  548:     {min_bin_vheap_size,46422} = process_info(self(), min_bin_vheap_size),
  549:     {max_heap_size, #{ size := 0, kill := true, error_logger := true,
  550:                        include_shared_binaries := false}} =
  551:         process_info(self(), max_heap_size),
  552:     {current_function,{?MODULE,t_process_info,1}} =
  553: 	process_info(self(), current_function),
  554:     {current_function,{?MODULE,t_process_info,1}} =
  555: 	apply(erlang, process_info, [self(),current_function]),
  556: 
  557:     %% current_location and current_stacktrace
  558:     {Line1,Res1} = {?LINE,process_info(self(), current_location)},
  559:     verify_loc(Line1, Res1),
  560:     {Line2,Res2} = {?LINE,apply(erlang, process_info,
  561: 				[self(),current_location])},
  562:     verify_loc(Line2, Res2),
  563:     pi_stacktrace([{?MODULE,t_process_info,1,?LINE}]),
  564: 
  565:     verify_stacktrace_depth(),
  566: 
  567:     Gleader = group_leader(),
  568:     {group_leader, Gleader} = process_info(self(), group_leader),
  569:     {'EXIT',{badarg,_Info}} = (catch process_info('not_a_pid')),
  570:     ok.
  571: 
  572: verify_stacktrace_depth() ->
  573:     CS = current_stacktrace,
  574:     OldDepth = erlang:system_flag(backtrace_depth, 0),
  575:     {CS,[]} = erlang:process_info(self(), CS),
  576:     _ = erlang:system_flag(backtrace_depth, 8),
  577:     {CS,[{?MODULE,verify_stacktrace_depth,0,_},_|_]} =
  578:         erlang:process_info(self(), CS),
  579:     _ = erlang:system_flag(backtrace_depth, OldDepth).
  580: 
  581: pi_stacktrace(Expected0) ->
  582:     {Line,Res} = {?LINE,erlang:process_info(self(), current_stacktrace)},
  583:     {current_stacktrace,Stack} = Res,
  584:     Expected = [{?MODULE,pi_stacktrace,1,Line}|Expected0],
  585:     pi_stacktrace_1(Stack, Expected).
  586: 
  587: pi_stacktrace_1([{M,F,A,Loc}|Stk], [{M,F,A,Line}|Exp]) ->
  588:     case Loc of
  589: 	[] ->
  590: 	    %% No location info for some reason (+L, native code).
  591: 	    io:format("Missing location information for ~w:~w/~w",
  592: 		      [M,F,A]),
  593: 	    ok;
  594: 	[_|_] ->
  595: 	    Line = proplists:get_value(line, Loc),
  596: 	    File = proplists:get_value(file, Loc),
  597: 	    File = ?MODULE_STRING ++ ".erl"
  598:     end,
  599:     pi_stacktrace_1(Stk, Exp);
  600: pi_stacktrace_1([_|_], []) -> ok.
  601: 
  602: verify_loc(Line, {current_location,{?MODULE,t_process_info=F,1=A,Loc}}) ->
  603:     case Loc of
  604: 	[] ->
  605: 	    %% No location info for some reason (+L, native code).
  606: 	    io:format("Missing location information for ~w:~w/~w",
  607: 		      [?MODULE,F,A]),
  608: 	    ok;
  609: 	[_|_] ->
  610: 	    Line = proplists:get_value(line, Loc),
  611: 	    File = proplists:get_value(file, Loc),
  612: 	    File = ?MODULE_STRING ++ ".erl"
  613:     end.
  614: 
  615: process_info_other(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  616:     Self = self(),
  617:     Pid = spawn_link(fun() -> process_info_looper(Self) end),
  618:     receive after 1 -> ok end,
  619:     pio_current_location(10000, Pid, 0, 0),
  620:     pio_current_stacktrace().
  621: 
  622: pio_current_location(0, _, Pi, Looper) ->
  623:     io:format("~w call(s) to erlang:process_info/2", [Pi]),
  624:     io:format("~w call(s) to ~w:process_info_looper/1", [Looper,?MODULE]);
  625: pio_current_location(N, Pid, Pi, Looper) ->
  626:     erlang:yield(),
  627:     {current_location,Where} = process_info(Pid, current_location),
  628:     case Where of
  629: 	{erlang,process_info,2,[]} ->
  630: 	    pio_current_location(N-1, Pid, Pi+1, Looper);
  631: 	{erts_internal,await_result,1, Loc} when is_list(Loc) ->
  632: 	    pio_current_location(N-1, Pid, Pi+1, Looper);
  633: 	{?MODULE,process_info_looper,1,Loc} when is_list(Loc) ->
  634: 	    pio_current_location(N-1, Pid, Pi, Looper+1);
  635: 	_ ->
  636: 	    exit({unexpected_location, Where})
  637:     end.
  638: 
  639: pio_current_stacktrace() ->
  640:     L = [begin
  641: 	     case process_info(P, current_stacktrace) of
  642:                  {current_stacktrace, Stk} -> {P,Stk};
  643:                  undefined -> {P, []}
  644:              end
  645: 	 end || P <- processes()],
  646:     [erlang:garbage_collect(P) || {P,_} <- L],
  647:     erlang:garbage_collect(),
  648:     [verify_stacktrace(Stk) || {_,Stk} <- L],
  649:     ok.
  650: 
  651: verify_stacktrace([{M,F,A,Loc}|T])
  652:   when is_atom(M),
  653:        is_atom(F),
  654:        is_integer(A),
  655:        is_list(Loc) ->
  656:     verify_stacktrace(T);
  657: verify_stacktrace([]) -> ok.
  658: 
  659: process_info_looper(Parent) ->
  660:     process_info(Parent, current_location),
  661:     process_info_looper(Parent).
  662: 
  663: %% Tests the process_info/1 BIF on another process with messages.
  664: process_info_other_msg(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  665:     Self = self(),
  666:     Pid = spawn_link(fun() -> other_process(Self) end),
  667:     receive
  668: 	{go_ahead,Pid} -> ok
  669:     end,
  670: 
  671:     Own = {my,own,message},
  672: 
  673:     {messages,[Own]} = process_info(Pid, messages),
  674:     
  675:     Garbage = kb_128(),
  676:     MsgA = {a,Garbage},
  677:     MsgB = {b,Garbage},
  678:     MsgC = {c,Garbage},
  679:     MsgD = {d,Garbage},
  680:     MsgE = {e,Garbage},
  681: 
  682:     Pid ! MsgA,
  683:     {messages,[Own,MsgA]} = process_info(Pid, messages),
  684:     Pid ! MsgB,
  685:     {messages,[Own,MsgA,MsgB]} = process_info(Pid, messages),
  686:     Pid ! MsgC,
  687:     {messages,[Own,MsgA,MsgB,MsgC]} = process_info(Pid, messages),
  688:     Pid ! MsgD,
  689:     {messages,[Own,MsgA,MsgB,MsgC,MsgD]} = process_info(Pid, messages),
  690:     Pid ! MsgE,
  691:     {messages,[Own,MsgA,MsgB,MsgC,MsgD,MsgE]=All} = process_info(Pid, messages),
  692:     {memory,BytesOther} = process_info(Pid, memory),
  693:     {memory,BytesSelf} = process_info(self(), memory),
  694: 
  695:     io:format("Memory ~p: ~p\n", [Pid,BytesOther]),
  696:     io:format("Memory ~p (self): ~p\n", [self(),BytesSelf]),
  697: 
  698:     [Own,MsgA,MsgB,MsgC,MsgD,MsgE] = All,
  699: 
  700:     Pid ! {self(),empty},
  701:     receive
  702: 	      empty -> ok
  703: 	  end,
  704:     {messages,[]} = process_info(Pid, messages),
  705: 
  706:     {min_heap_size, 233} = process_info(Pid, min_heap_size),
  707:     {min_bin_vheap_size, 46422} = process_info(Pid, min_bin_vheap_size),
  708:     {max_heap_size, #{ size := 0, kill := true, error_logger := true,
  709:                        include_shared_binaries := false}} =
  710:         process_info(Pid, max_heap_size),
  711: 
  712:     Pid ! stop,
  713:     ok.
  714: 
  715: process_info_other_message_queue_len_signal_race(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  716:     %% OTP-18169
  717:     %%
  718:     %% The race window triggering this bug is quite small. This test
  719:     %% wont fail even with the bug present, but it may trigger an
  720:     %% assertion in the debug compiled emulator if the bug is
  721:     %% present...
  722:     process_flag(priority, high),
  723:     SSchdlr = case erlang:system_info(schedulers_online) of
  724:                   1 -> 1;
  725:                   _ -> 2
  726:               end,
  727:     Flush = fun Flush () ->
  728:                     receive _ -> Flush()
  729:                     after 0 -> ok
  730:                     end
  731:             end,
  732:     RFun = fun RFun () ->
  733:                    receive
  734:                        {flush, From} ->
  735:                            Flush(),
  736:                            From ! flushed
  737:                    end,
  738:                    RFun()
  739:            end,
  740:     R = spawn_opt(RFun, [link,
  741:                          {scheduler, 1},
  742:                          {message_queue_data, on_heap}]),
  743:     SFun = fun SFun () ->
  744:                    receive go -> ok end,
  745:                    M = erlang:monitor(process, R),
  746:                    R ! hi,
  747:                    receive
  748:                        {demonitor, From} ->
  749:                            _ = erlang:demonitor(M),
  750:                            From ! demonitored
  751:                    end,
  752:                    SFun()
  753:            end,
  754:     S = spawn_opt(SFun, [link,
  755:                          {scheduler, SSchdlr},
  756:                          {priority, high}]),
  757:     process_info_other_message_queue_len_signal_race_test(10000, S, R),
  758:     unlink(R),
  759:     exit(R, kill),
  760:     unlink(S),
  761:     exit(S, kill),
  762:     false = is_process_alive(R),
  763:     false = is_process_alive(S),
  764:     ok.
  765: 
  766: process_info_other_message_queue_len_signal_race_test(0, _S, _R) ->
  767:     ok;
  768: process_info_other_message_queue_len_signal_race_test(N, S, R) ->
  769:     S ! go,
  770:     erlang:yield(),
  771:     _ = process_info(R, message_queue_len),
  772:     S ! {demonitor, self()},
  773:     receive demonitored -> ok end,
  774:     R ! {flush, self()},
  775:     receive flushed -> ok end,
  776:     process_info_other_message_queue_len_signal_race_test(N-1, S, R).
  777: 
  778: process_info_other_dist_msg(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  779:     %%
  780:     %% Check that process_info can handle messages that have not been
  781:     %% decoded yet.
  782:     %%
  783:     {ok, Peer, Node} = ?CT_PEER(),
  784:     Self = self(),
  785:     Pid = spawn_link(fun() -> other_process(Self) end),
  786:     receive {go_ahead,Pid} -> ok end,
  787: 
  788:     Own = {my,own,message},
  789: 
  790:     {messages,[Own]} = process_info(Pid, messages),
  791:     Garbage = kb_128(),
  792:     MsgA = {a,self(),Garbage},
  793:     MsgB = {b,self(),Garbage},
  794:     MsgC = {c,self(),Garbage},
  795:     MsgD = {d,self(),Garbage},
  796:     MsgE = {e,self(),Garbage},
  797: 
  798:     %% We don't want the other process to decode messages itself
  799:     %% therefore we suspend it.
  800:     true =  erlang:suspend_process(Pid),
  801:     spawn_link(Node, fun () ->
  802: 		Pid  ! MsgA,
  803: 		Pid  ! MsgB,
  804: 		Pid  ! MsgC,
  805: 		Self ! check_abc
  806: 	end),
  807:     receive check_abc -> ok end,
  808:     [{status,suspended},
  809: 	{messages,[Own,MsgA,MsgB,MsgC]},
  810: 	{status,suspended}]= process_info(Pid, [status,messages,status]),
  811:     spawn_link(Node, fun () ->
  812: 		Pid  ! MsgD,
  813: 		Pid  ! MsgE,
  814: 		Self ! check_de
  815: 	end),
  816:     receive check_de -> ok end,
  817:     {messages,[Own,MsgA,MsgB,MsgC,MsgD,MsgE]=All} = process_info(Pid, messages),
  818:     true = erlang:resume_process(Pid),
  819:     Pid ! {self(), get_all_messages},
  820:     receive
  821: 	      {all_messages, AllMsgs} ->
  822: 		  All = AllMsgs
  823: 	  end,
  824:     {messages,[]} = process_info(Pid, messages),
  825:     Pid ! stop,
  826:     stop_node(Peer, Node),
  827:     ok.
  828: 
  829: process_info_other_status(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  830:     %% OTP-17628: status was erroneously reported as 'running',
  831:     %% when it should be 'waiting', when the priority of the
  832:     %% caller exceeded the priority of the processes being
  833:     %% checked (due to prio elevation).
  834:     Self = self(),
  835:     Other = spawn_link(fun () -> other_process(Self) end),
  836:     receive {go_ahead, Other} -> ok end,
  837:     receive after 100 -> ok end,
  838:     {status, waiting} = process_info(Other, status),
  839:     process_flag(priority, high),
  840:     {status, waiting} = process_info(Other, status),
  841:     process_flag(priority, max),
  842:     {status, waiting} = process_info(Other, status),
  843:     Other ! stop,
  844:     ok.
  845: 
  846: other_process(Parent) ->
  847:     self() ! {my,own,message},
  848:     Parent ! {go_ahead,self()},
  849:     other_process_1().
  850: 
  851: other_process_1() ->
  852:     receive
  853: 	{Parent,get_all_messages} ->
  854: 	    Parent ! {all_messages, get_all_messages()},
  855: 	    other_process_1();
  856: 	{Parent,empty} ->
  857: 	    receive_all(),
  858: 	    Parent ! empty,
  859: 	    other_process_1();
  860: 	stop -> ok
  861:     end.
  862: 
  863: get_all_messages() ->
  864:     get_all_messages([]).
  865: 
  866: get_all_messages(Msgs) ->
  867:     receive
  868: 	Msg ->
  869: 	    get_all_messages([Msg|Msgs])
  870:     after 0 ->
  871: 	    lists:reverse(Msgs)
  872:     end.
  873: 
  874: receive_all() ->
  875:     receive
  876: 	_ -> receive_all()
  877:     after 0 -> ok
  878:     end.
  879: 
  880: chk_pi_order([],[]) ->
  881:     ok;
  882: chk_pi_order([{Arg, _}| Values], [Arg|Args]) ->
  883:     chk_pi_order(Values, Args).
  884: 
  885: process_info_2_list(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  886:     Proc = spawn_link(fun () -> receive after infinity -> ok end end),
  887:     register(process_SUITE_process_info_2_list1, self()),
  888:     register(process_SUITE_process_info_2_list2, Proc),
  889:     erts_debug:set_internal_state(available_internal_state,true),
  890:     AllArgs = erts_debug:get_internal_state(process_info_args),
  891:     A1 = lists:sort(AllArgs) ++ [status] ++ lists:reverse(AllArgs),
  892: 
  893:     %% Verify that argument is accepted as single atom
  894:     lists:foreach(fun (A) ->
  895: 		{A, _} = process_info(Proc, A),
  896: 		{A, _} = process_info(self(), A)
  897: 	end, A1),
  898: 
  899:     %% Verify that order is preserved
  900:     ok = chk_pi_order(process_info(self(), A1), A1),
  901:     ok = chk_pi_order(process_info(Proc, A1), A1),
  902: 
  903:     %% Small arg list
  904:     A2 = [status, stack_size, trap_exit, priority],
  905:     [{status, _}, {stack_size, _}, {trap_exit, _}, {priority, _}]
  906: 	= process_info(Proc, A2),
  907:     [{status, _}, {stack_size, _}, {trap_exit, _}, {priority, _}]
  908: 	= process_info(self(), A2),
  909: 
  910:     %% Huge arg list (note values are shared)
  911:     A3 = lists:duplicate(5000,backtrace),
  912:     V3 = process_info(Proc, A3),
  913:     5000 = length(V3),
  914:     lists:foreach(fun ({backtrace, _}) -> ok end, V3),
  915:     ok.
  916:     
  917: process_info_lock_reschedule(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  918:     %% We need a process that is running and an item that requires
  919:     %% process_info to take the main process lock.
  920:     Target1 = spawn_link(fun tok_loop/0),
  921:     Name1 = process_info_lock_reschedule_running,
  922:     register(Name1, Target1),
  923:     Target2 = spawn_link(fun () -> receive after infinity -> ok end end),
  924:     Name2 = process_info_lock_reschedule_waiting,
  925:     register(Name2, Target2),
  926:     PI = fun(_) ->
  927: 	    erlang:yield(),
  928: 	    [{registered_name, Name1}] = process_info(Target1, [registered_name]),
  929: 	    [{registered_name, Name2}] = process_info(Target2, [registered_name]),
  930: 	    erlang:yield(),
  931: 	    {registered_name, Name1} = process_info(Target1, registered_name),
  932: 	    {registered_name, Name2} = process_info(Target2, registered_name),
  933: 	    erlang:yield(),
  934: 	    [{registered_name, Name1}| _] = process_info(Target1),
  935: 	    [{registered_name, Name2}| _] = process_info(Target2)
  936:     end,
  937:     lists:foreach(PI, lists:seq(1,1000)),
  938:     %% Make sure Target1 still is willing to "tok loop"
  939:     case process_info(Target1, status) of
  940: 	{status, OkStatus} when OkStatus == runnable;
  941: 				OkStatus == running;
  942: 				OkStatus == garbage_collecting ->
  943: 	    unlink(Target1),
  944: 	    unlink(Target2),
  945: 	    exit(Target1, bang),
  946: 	    exit(Target2, bang),
  947: 	    OkStatus;
  948: 	{status, BadStatus} ->
  949: 	    ct:fail(BadStatus)
  950:     end.
  951: 
  952: pi_loop(_Name, _Pid, 0) ->
  953:     ok;
  954: pi_loop(Name, Pid, N) ->
  955:     {registered_name, Name} = process_info(Pid, registered_name),
  956:     pi_loop(Name, Pid, N-1).
  957: 
  958: process_info_lock_reschedule2(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  959:     Parent = self(),
  960:     Fun = fun () ->
  961: 	    receive {go, Name, Pid} -> ok end,
  962: 	    pi_loop(Name, Pid, 10000),
  963: 	    Parent ! {done, self()},
  964: 	    receive after infinity -> ok end
  965:     end,
  966:     P1 = spawn_link(Fun),
  967:     N1 = process_info_lock_reschedule2_1,
  968:     true = register(N1, P1),
  969:     P2 = spawn_link(Fun),
  970:     N2 = process_info_lock_reschedule2_2,
  971:     true = register(N2, P2),
  972:     P3 = spawn_link(Fun),
  973:     N3 = process_info_lock_reschedule2_3,
  974:     true = register(N3, P3),
  975:     P4 = spawn_link(Fun),
  976:     N4 = process_info_lock_reschedule2_4,
  977:     true = register(N4, P4),
  978:     P5 = spawn_link(Fun),
  979:     N5 = process_info_lock_reschedule2_5,
  980:     true = register(N5, P5),
  981:     P6 = spawn_link(Fun),
  982:     N6 = process_info_lock_reschedule2_6,
  983:     true = register(N6, P6),
  984:     P1 ! {go, N2, P2},
  985:     P2 ! {go, N1, P1},
  986:     P3 ! {go, N1, P1},
  987:     P4 ! {go, N1, P1},
  988:     P5 ! {go, N6, P6},
  989:     P6 ! {go, N5, P5},
  990:     receive {done, P1} -> ok end,
  991:     receive {done, P2} -> ok end,
  992:     receive {done, P3} -> ok end,
  993:     receive {done, P4} -> ok end,
  994:     receive {done, P5} -> ok end,
  995:     receive {done, P6} -> ok end,
  996:     unlink(P1), exit(P1, bang),
  997:     unlink(P2), exit(P2, bang),
  998:     unlink(P3), exit(P3, bang),
  999:     unlink(P4), exit(P4, bang),
 1000:     unlink(P5), exit(P5, bang),
 1001:     unlink(P6), exit(P6, bang),
 1002:     ok.
 1003: 
 1004: many_args(0,_B,_C,_D,_E,_F,_G,_H,_I,_J) ->
 1005:     ok;
 1006: many_args(A,B,C,D,E,F,G,H,I,J) ->
 1007:     many_args(A-1,B,C,D,E,F,G,H,I,J).
 1008: 
 1009: do_pi_msg_len(PT, AT) ->
 1010:     lists:map(fun (_) -> ok end, [a,b,c,d]),
 1011:     {message_queue_len, _} = process_info(element(2,PT), element(2,AT)).
 1012:     
 1013: process_info_lock_reschedule3(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1014:     %% We need a process that is running and an item that requires
 1015:     %% process_info to take the main process lock.
 1016:     Target1 = spawn_link(fun tok_loop/0),
 1017:     Name1 = process_info_lock_reschedule_running,
 1018:     register(Name1, Target1),
 1019:     Target2 = spawn_link(fun () -> receive after infinity -> ok end end),
 1020:     Name2 = process_info_lock_reschedule_waiting,
 1021:     register(Name2, Target2),
 1022:     PI = fun(N) ->
 1023: 	    case N rem 10 of
 1024: 		0 -> erlang:yield();
 1025: 		_ -> ok
 1026: 	    end,
 1027: 	    do_pi_msg_len({proc, Target1},
 1028: 		{arg, message_queue_len})
 1029:     end,
 1030:     many_args(100000,1,2,3,4,5,6,7,8,9),
 1031:     lists:foreach(PI, lists:seq(1,1000000)),
 1032:     %% Make sure Target1 still is willing to "tok loop"
 1033:     case process_info(Target1, status) of
 1034: 	      {status, OkStatus} when OkStatus == runnable;
 1035: 				      OkStatus == running;
 1036: 				      OkStatus == garbage_collecting ->
 1037: 		  unlink(Target1),
 1038: 		  unlink(Target2),
 1039: 		  exit(Target1, bang),
 1040: 		  exit(Target2, bang),
 1041: 		  OkStatus;
 1042: 	      {status, BadStatus} ->
 1043: 		  ct:fail(BadStatus)
 1044: 	  end.
 1045: 
 1046: otp_4725(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1047:     Tester = self(),
 1048:     Ref1 = make_ref(),
 1049:     Pid1 = spawn_opt(fun () ->
 1050: 		Tester ! {Ref1, process_info(self())},
 1051: 		receive
 1052: 		    Ref1 -> bye
 1053: 		end
 1054: 	end, [link, {priority, max}, {fullsweep_after, 600}]),
 1055:     receive
 1056: 	{Ref1, ProcInfo1A} ->
 1057: 	    ProcInfo1B = process_info(Pid1),
 1058: 	    Pid1 ! Ref1,
 1059: 	    check_proc_infos(ProcInfo1A, ProcInfo1B)
 1060:     end,
 1061:     Ref2 = make_ref(),
 1062:     Pid2 = spawn_opt(fun () ->
 1063: 		Tester ! {Ref2, process_info(self())},
 1064: 		receive
 1065: 		    Ref2 -> bye
 1066: 		end
 1067: 	end,
 1068: 	[]),
 1069:     receive
 1070: 	{Ref2, ProcInfo2A} ->
 1071: 	    ProcInfo2B = process_info(Pid2),
 1072: 	    Pid2 ! Ref2,
 1073: 	    check_proc_infos(ProcInfo2A, ProcInfo2B)
 1074:     end,
 1075:     ok.
 1076: 
 1077: check_proc_infos(A, B) ->
 1078:     IC = lists:keysearch(initial_call, 1, A),
 1079:     IC = lists:keysearch(initial_call, 1, B),
 1080: 
 1081:     L = lists:keysearch(links, 1, A),
 1082:     L = lists:keysearch(links, 1, B),
 1083: 
 1084:     D = lists:keysearch(dictionary, 1, A),
 1085:     D = lists:keysearch(dictionary, 1, B),
 1086: 
 1087:     TE = lists:keysearch(trap_exit, 1, A),
 1088:     TE = lists:keysearch(trap_exit, 1, B),
 1089: 
 1090:     EH = lists:keysearch(error_handler, 1, A),
 1091:     EH = lists:keysearch(error_handler, 1, B),
 1092: 
 1093:     P = lists:keysearch(priority, 1, A),
 1094:     P = lists:keysearch(priority, 1, B),
 1095: 
 1096:     GL = lists:keysearch(group_leader, 1, A),
 1097:     GL = lists:keysearch(group_leader, 1, B),
 1098: 
 1099:     GC = lists:keysearch(garbage_collection, 1, A),
 1100:     GC = lists:keysearch(garbage_collection, 1, B),
 1101:     {value, {garbage_collection, GClist}} = GC,
 1102: 
 1103:     %% This is not really documented
 1104:     true = is_integer(gv(minor_gcs, GClist)),
 1105:     true = is_integer(gv(fullsweep_after, GClist)),
 1106:     true = is_integer(gv(min_heap_size, GClist)),
 1107:     #{error_logger := Bool1,
 1108:       include_shared_binaries := Bool2,
 1109:       kill := Bool3,
 1110:       size := MaxHeapSize} = gv(max_heap_size, GClist),
 1111:     true = is_boolean(Bool1),
 1112:     true = is_boolean(Bool2),
 1113:     true = is_boolean(Bool3),
 1114:     true = is_integer(MaxHeapSize),
 1115: 
 1116:     ok.
 1117:
