 1120: 
 1121: start_spawner() ->
 1122:     ok.
 1123: 
 1124: stop_spawner() ->
 1125:     ok.
 1126: 
 1127: %% Tests erlang:process_info(Pid, garbage_collection_info)
 1128: process_info_garbage_collection(_Config) ->
 1129:     Parent = self(),
 1130:     Pid = spawn_link(
 1131:             fun() ->
 1132:                     %% We set mqd to off_heap and send an tuple
 1133:                     %% to process in order to force mbuf_size
 1134:                     %% to be used
 1135:                     process_flag(message_queue_data, off_heap),
 1136:                     receive go -> ok end,
 1137:                     (fun F(0) ->
 1138:                              Parent ! deep,
 1139:                              receive {ok,_} -> ok end,
 1140:                              [];
 1141:                          F(N) ->
 1142:                              timer:sleep(1),
 1143:                              [lists:seq(1,100) | F(N-1)]
 1144:                      end)(1000),
 1145:                     Parent ! shallow,
 1146:                     receive done -> ok end
 1147:             end),
 1148:     [{garbage_collection_info, Before},{total_heap_size, THSBefore}] =
 1149:         erlang:process_info(Pid, [garbage_collection_info, total_heap_size]),
 1150:     Pid ! go, receive deep -> ok end,
 1151:     [{_, Deep},{_,THSDeep}]  =
 1152:          erlang:process_info(Pid, [garbage_collection_info, total_heap_size]),
 1153:     Pid ! {ok, make_ref()}, receive shallow -> ok end,
 1154:     [{_, After},{_, THSAfter}] =
 1155:         erlang:process_info(Pid, [garbage_collection_info, total_heap_size]),
 1156:     Pid ! done,
 1157: 
 1158:     %% Do some general checks to see if everything seems to be roughly correct
 1159:     ct:log("Before: ~p",[Before]),
 1160:     ct:log("Deep: ~p",[Deep]),
 1161:     ct:log("After: ~p",[After]),
 1162:     ct:log("Before THS: ~p",[THSBefore]),
 1163:     ct:log("Deep THS: ~p",[THSDeep]),
 1164:     ct:log("After THS: ~p",[THSAfter]),
 1165: 
 1166:     %% Check stack_size
 1167:     true = gv(stack_size, Before) < gv(stack_size, Deep),
 1168:     true = gv(stack_size, After) < gv(stack_size, Deep),
 1169: 
 1170:     %% Check used heap size
 1171:     true = gv(heap_size, Before) + gv(old_heap_size, Before)
 1172:         < gv(heap_size, Deep) + gv(old_heap_size, Deep),
 1173:     true = gv(heap_size, Before) + gv(old_heap_size, Before)
 1174:         < gv(heap_size, After) + gv(old_heap_size, After),
 1175: 
 1176:     %% Check that total_heap_size == heap_block_size + old_heap_block_size + mbuf_size
 1177:     THSBefore = gv(heap_block_size, Before)
 1178:         + gv(old_heap_block_size, Before)
 1179:         + gv(mbuf_size, Before),
 1180: 
 1181:     THSDeep = gv(heap_block_size, Deep)
 1182:         + gv(old_heap_block_size, Deep)
 1183:         + gv(mbuf_size, Deep),
 1184: 
 1185:     THSAfter = gv(heap_block_size, After)
 1186:         + gv(old_heap_block_size, After)
 1187:         + gv(mbuf_size, After),
 1188: 
 1189:     ok.
 1190: 
 1191: gv(Key,List) ->
 1192:     proplists:get_value(Key,List).
 1193: 
 1194: process_info_parent(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1195:     Child = spawn_link(fun () -> receive stop -> ok end end),
 1196:     ?assertEqual({parent, self()}, erlang:process_info(Child, parent)),
 1197:     Child ! stop,
 1198:     ?assertEqual({parent, undefined}, erlang:process_info(whereis(init), parent)),
 1199: 
 1200:     {ok, Peer, Node} = ?CT_PEER(),
 1201:     RemoteChild = spawn_link(Node,
 1202:                              fun () ->
 1203:                                      {parent, Parent} = process_info(self(), parent),
 1204:                                      garbage_collect(),
 1205:                                      {parent, Parent} = process_info(self(), parent),
 1206:                                      garbage_collect(),
 1207:                                      Parent ! remote_child_hello,
 1208:                                      receive stop -> ok end
 1209:                              end),
 1210:     ?assertEqual({parent, self()},
 1211:                  erpc:call(Node, erlang, process_info, [RemoteChild, parent])),
 1212:     receive remote_child_hello -> ok end,
 1213:     unlink(RemoteChild),
 1214:     RemoteChild ! stop,
 1215:     peer:stop(Peer),
 1216:     ok.
 1217: 
 1218: process_info_smoke_all_tester() ->
 1219:     register(process_info_smoke_all_tester, self()),
 1220:     put(ets_ref, ets:new(blupp, [])),
 1221:     put(binary, [list_to_binary(lists:duplicate(1000, 1)),
 1222:                  list_to_binary(lists:duplicate(1000, 2))]),
 1223:     process_info_smoke_all_tester_loop().
 1224: 
 1225: process_info_smoke_all_tester_loop() ->
 1226:     receive
 1227:         {other_process, Pid} ->
 1228:             case get(procs) of
 1229:                 undefined -> put(procs, [Pid]);
 1230:                 Procs -> put(procs, [Pid|Procs])
 1231:             end,
 1232:             erlang:monitor(process, Pid),
 1233:             link(Pid),
 1234:             process_info_smoke_all_tester_loop()
 1235:     end.
 1236: 
 1237: process_info_smoke_all(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1238:     AllPIOptions = [registered_name,
 1239:                     current_function,
 1240:                     initial_call,
 1241:                     messages,
 1242:                     message_queue_len,
 1243:                     links,
 1244:                     monitors,
 1245:                     monitored_by,
 1246:                     dictionary,
 1247:                     trap_exit,
 1248:                     error_handler,
 1249:                     heap_size,
 1250:                     stack_size,
 1251:                     memory,
 1252:                     garbage_collection,
 1253:                     group_leader,
 1254:                     reductions,
 1255:                     priority,
 1256:                     trace,
 1257:                     binary,
 1258:                     sequential_trace_token,
 1259:                     catchlevel,
 1260:                     backtrace,
 1261:                     last_calls,
 1262:                     total_heap_size,
 1263:                     suspending,
 1264:                     min_heap_size,
 1265:                     min_bin_vheap_size,
 1266:                     max_heap_size,
 1267:                     current_location,
 1268:                     current_stacktrace,
 1269:                     message_queue_data,
 1270:                     garbage_collection_info,
 1271:                     magic_ref,
 1272:                     fullsweep_after,
 1273:                     {dictionary, ets_ref}],
 1274: 
 1275:     {ok, Peer, Node} = ?CT_PEER(),
 1276:     RP = spawn_link(Node, fun process_info_smoke_all_tester/0),
 1277:     LP = spawn_link(fun process_info_smoke_all_tester/0),
 1278:     RP ! {other_process, LP},
 1279:     LP ! {other_process, RP},
 1280:     LP ! {other_process, self()},
 1281:     LP ! ets:new(blapp, []),
 1282:     LP ! ets:new(blipp, []),
 1283:     LP ! list_to_binary(lists:duplicate(1000, 3)),
 1284:     receive after 1000 -> ok end,
 1285:     _MLP = erlang:monitor(process, LP),
 1286:     true = is_process_alive(LP),
 1287:     PI = process_info(LP, AllPIOptions),
 1288:     io:format("~p~n", [PI]),
 1289:     garbage_collect(),
 1290:     unlink(RP),
 1291:     unlink(LP),
 1292:     exit(RP, kill),
 1293:     exit(LP, kill),
 1294:     false = is_process_alive(LP),
 1295:     stop_node(Peer, Node),
 1296:     ok.
 1297: 
 1298: process_info_status_handled_signal(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1299:     P = spawn_link(fun () ->
 1300:                            receive after infinity -> ok end
 1301:                    end),
 1302:     wait_until(fun () ->
 1303:                        process_info(P, status) == {status, waiting}
 1304:                end),
 1305:     %%
 1306:     %% The 'messages' option will force a process-info-request
 1307:     %% signal to be scheduled on the process. Ensure that status
 1308:     %% 'waiting' is reported even though it is actually running
 1309:     %% when handling the request. We want it to report the status
 1310:     %% it would have had if it had not been handling the
 1311:     %% process-info-request...
 1312:     %%
 1313:     [{status, waiting}, {messages, []}] = process_info(P, [status, messages]),
 1314:     unlink(P),
 1315:     exit(P, kill),
 1316:     false = erlang:is_process_alive(P),
 1317:     ok.
 1318: 
 1319: %% OTP-15709
 1320: %% Provoke a bug where process_info(reductions) returned wrong result
 1321: %% because REDS_IN (def_arg_reg[5]) is read when the process in not running.
 1322: %%
 1323: %% And a bug where process_info(reductions) on a process which was releasing its
 1324: %% main lock during execution could result in negative reduction diffs.
 1325: process_info_reductions(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1326:     {S1, S2} = case erlang:system_info(schedulers_online) of
 1327:                    1 -> {1,1};
 1328:                    _ -> {1,2}
 1329:                end,
 1330:     io:format("Run on schedulers ~p and ~p\n", [S1,S2]),
 1331:     Boss = self(),
 1332:     Doer = spawn_opt(fun () ->
 1333:                              pi_reductions_tester(true, 10, fun pi_reductions_spinnloop/0, S2),
 1334:                              pi_reductions_tester(true, 10, fun pi_reductions_recvloop/0, S2),
 1335:                              pi_reductions_tester(false, 100, fun pi_reductions_main_unlocker/0, S2),
 1336:                              Boss ! {self(), done}
 1337:                      end,
 1338:                      [link, {scheduler, S1}]),
 1339: 
 1340:     {Doer, done} = receive M -> M end,
 1341:     ok.
 1342: 
 1343: pi_reductions_tester(ForceSignal, MaxCalls, Fun, S2) ->
 1344:     Pid = spawn_opt(Fun, [link, {scheduler,S2}]),
 1345:     Extra = case ForceSignal of
 1346:                 true ->
 1347:                     %% Add another item that force sending the request
 1348:                     %% as a signal, like 'current_function'.
 1349:                     [current_function];
 1350:                 false ->
 1351:                     []
 1352:             end,
 1353:     LoopFun = fun Me(Calls, Prev, Acc0) ->
 1354:                       PI = process_info(Pid, [reductions | Extra]),
 1355:                       [{reductions,Reds} | _] = PI,
 1356:                       Diff = Reds - Prev,
 1357:                       %% Verify we get sane non-negative reduction diffs
 1358:                       {Diff, true} = {Diff, (Diff >= 0)},
 1359:                       {Diff, true} = {Diff, (Diff =< 1000*1000)},
 1360:                       Acc1 = [Diff | Acc0],
 1361:                       case Calls >= MaxCalls of
 1362:                           true -> Acc1;
 1363:                           false -> Me(Calls+1, Reds, Acc1)
 1364:                       end
 1365:               end,
 1366:     DiffList = LoopFun(0, 0, []),
 1367:     unlink(Pid),
 1368:     exit(Pid,kill),
 1369:     io:format("Reduction diffs: ~p\n", [lists:reverse(DiffList)]),
 1370:     ok.
 1371: 
 1372: pi_reductions_spinnloop() ->
 1373:     %% 6 args to make use of def_arg_reg[5] which is also used as REDS_IN
 1374:     pi_reductions_spinnloop(999*1000, atom, "hej", self(), make_ref(), 3.14).
 1375: 
 1376: pi_reductions_spinnloop(N,A,B,C,D,E) when N > 0 ->
 1377:     pi_reductions_spinnloop(N-1,B,C,D,E,A);
 1378: pi_reductions_spinnloop(0,_,_,_,_,_) ->
 1379:     %% Stop to limit max number of reductions consumed
 1380:     pi_reductions_recvloop().
 1381: 
 1382: pi_reductions_recvloop() ->
 1383:     receive
 1384:         "a free lunch" -> false
 1385:     end.
 1386: 
 1387: pi_reductions_main_unlocker() ->
 1388:     Other = spawn_link(fun() -> receive die -> ok end end),
 1389:     pi_reductions_main_unlocker_loop(Other).
 1390: 
 1391: pi_reductions_main_unlocker_loop(Other) ->
 1392:     %% Assumption: register(OtherPid, Name) will unlock main lock of calling
 1393:     %% process during execution.
 1394:     register(pi_reductions_main_unlocker, Other),
 1395:     unregister(pi_reductions_main_unlocker),
 1396: 
 1397:     %% Yield in order to increase probability of process_info sometimes probing
 1398:     %% this process when it's not RUNNING.
 1399:     erlang:yield(),
 1400:     pi_reductions_main_unlocker_loop(Other).
 1401: 
 1402: process_info_self_signal(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1403:     %% Test that signals that we have sent to ourselves are
 1404:     %% visible in process_info() result. This is not strictly
 1405:     %% a necessary property, but implemented so now. See
 1406:     %% process_info.c:process_info_bif() for more info.
 1407:     Self = self(),
 1408:     Ref = make_ref(),
 1409:     pi_sig_spam_test(fun () ->
 1410:                              process_info_self_signal_spammer(Self)
 1411:                      end,
 1412:                      fun () ->
 1413:                              self() ! Ref,
 1414:                              process_info(self(), messages)
 1415:                      end,
 1416:                      fun (Res) ->
 1417:                              {messages, [Ref]} = Res
 1418:                      end).
 1419: 
 1420: process_info_self_signal_spammer(To) ->
 1421:     erlang:demonitor(erlang:monitor(process, To)),
 1422:     process_info_self_signal_spammer(To).
 1423: 
 1424: process_info_self_msgq_len(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1425:     %% Spam ourselves with signals forcing us to flush own
 1426:     %% signal queue..
 1427:     Self = self(),
 1428:     pi_sig_spam_test(fun () ->
 1429:                              process_info_self_msgq_len_spammer(Self)
 1430:                      end,
 1431:                      fun () ->
 1432:                              process_info(self(), message_queue_len)
 1433:                      end,
 1434:                      fun (Res) ->
 1435:                              {message_queue_len, Len} = Res,
 1436:                              true = Len > 0,
 1437:                              ok
 1438:                      end).
 1439: 
 1440: 
 1441: process_info_self_msgq_len_messages(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1442:     %% Spam ourselves with signals normally forcing us to flush own
 1443:     %% signal queue, but since we also want messages wont be flushed...
 1444:     Self = self(),
 1445:     pi_sig_spam_test(fun () ->
 1446:                              process_info_self_msgq_len_spammer(Self, 100000)
 1447:                      end,
 1448:                      fun () ->
 1449:                              process_info(self(),
 1450:                                           [message_queue_len,
 1451:                                            messages])
 1452:                      end,
 1453:                      fun (Res) ->
 1454:                              [{message_queue_len, Len},
 1455:                               {messages, Msgs}] = Res,
 1456:                              Len = length(Msgs),
 1457:                              ok
 1458:                      end).
 1459: 
 1460: process_info_self_msgq_len_more(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1461:     self() ! hej,
 1462:     BodyRes = process_info_self_msgq_len_more_caller_body(),
 1463:     ok = process_info_self_msgq_len_more_caller_body_result(BodyRes),
 1464:     TailRes = process_info_self_msgq_len_more_caller_tail(),
 1465:     ok = process_info_self_msgq_len_more_caller_tail_result(TailRes),
 1466:     receive hej -> ok end,
 1467:     %% Check that current_function, current_location, and
 1468:     %% current_stacktrace give sane results flushing or not...
 1469:     Self = self(),
 1470:     pi_sig_spam_test(fun () ->
 1471:                              process_info_self_msgq_len_spammer(Self)
 1472:                      end,
 1473:                      fun process_info_self_msgq_len_more_caller_body/0,
 1474:                      fun process_info_self_msgq_len_more_caller_body_result/1),
 1475:     pi_sig_spam_test(fun () ->
 1476:                              process_info_self_msgq_len_spammer(Self)
 1477:                      end,
 1478:                      fun process_info_self_msgq_len_more_caller_tail/0,
 1479:                      fun process_info_self_msgq_len_more_caller_tail_result/1).
 1480: 
 1481: process_info_self_msgq_len_more_caller_body() ->
 1482:     Res = process_info(self(),
 1483:                        [message_queue_len,
 1484:                         current_function,
 1485:                         current_location,
 1486:                         current_stacktrace]),
 1487:     id(Res).
 1488: 
 1489: process_info_self_msgq_len_more_caller_body_result(Res) ->
 1490:     [{message_queue_len, Len},
 1491:      {current_function, {process_SUITE,process_info_self_msgq_len_more_caller_body,0}},
 1492:      {current_location, {process_SUITE,process_info_self_msgq_len_more_caller_body,0,_}},
 1493:      {current_stacktrace,
 1494:       [{process_SUITE,process_info_self_msgq_len_more_caller_body,0,_} | _]}] = Res,
 1495:     true = Len > 0,
 1496:     ok.
 1497: 
 1498: process_info_self_msgq_len_more_caller_tail() ->
 1499:     process_info(self(),
 1500:                  [message_queue_len,
 1501:                   current_function,
 1502:                   current_location,
 1503:                   current_stacktrace]).
 1504: 
 1505: process_info_self_msgq_len_more_caller_tail_result(Res) ->
 1506:     [{message_queue_len, Len},
 1507:      {current_function, {process_SUITE,process_info_self_msgq_len_more_caller_tail,0}},
 1508:      {current_location, {process_SUITE,process_info_self_msgq_len_more_caller_tail,0,_}},
 1509:      {current_stacktrace,
 1510:       [{process_SUITE,process_info_self_msgq_len_more_caller_tail,0,_} | _]}] = Res,
 1511:     true = Len > 0,
 1512:     ok.
 1513:     
 1514: 
 1515: process_info_self_msgq_len_spammer(To) ->
 1516:     process_info_self_msgq_len_spammer(To, 10000000).
 1517: 
 1518: process_info_self_msgq_len_spammer(_To, 0) ->
 1519:     ok;
 1520: process_info_self_msgq_len_spammer(To, N) ->
 1521:     To ! hejhopp,
 1522:     erlang:demonitor(erlang:monitor(process, To)),
 1523:     process_info_self_msgq_len_spammer(To, N-1).
 1524: 
 1525: pi_sig_spam_test(SpamFun, PITest, PICheckRes) ->
 1526:     SO = erlang:system_flag(schedulers_online, 1),
 1527:     try
 1528:         Self = self(),
 1529:         SigSpammer = spawn_link(SpamFun),
 1530:         process_flag(priority, low),
 1531:         receive after 10 -> ok end,
 1532:         Res = PITest(),
 1533:         process_flag(priority, high),
 1534:         unlink(SigSpammer),
 1535:         exit(SigSpammer, kill),
 1536:         false = is_process_alive(SigSpammer),
 1537:         PICheckRes(Res)
 1538:     after
 1539:         _ = erlang:system_flag(schedulers_online, SO)
 1540:     end.
 1541: 
 1542: process_info_msgq_len_no_very_long_delay(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1543:     Tester = self(),
 1544:     P1 = spawn_link(fun () ->
 1545:                             receive after infinity -> ok end
 1546:                     end),
 1547:     {message_queue_len, 0} = process_info(self(), message_queue_len),
 1548:     {message_queue_len, 0} = process_info(P1, message_queue_len),
 1549:     P2 = spawn_link(fun () ->
 1550:                             Tester ! hello,
 1551:                             P1 ! hello,
 1552:                             receive after infinity -> ok end
 1553:                     end),
 1554:     receive after 100 -> ok end,
 1555:     {message_queue_len, 1} = process_info(self(), message_queue_len),
 1556:     {message_queue_len, 1} = process_info(P1, message_queue_len),
 1557:     receive hello -> ok end,
 1558:     {message_queue_len, 0} = process_info(self(), message_queue_len),
 1559:     unlink(P1),
 1560:     exit(P1, kill),
 1561:     unlink(P2),
 1562:     exit(P2, kill),
 1563:     false = is_process_alive(P1),
 1564:     false = is_process_alive(P2),
 1565:     ok.
 1566: 
 1567: process_info_dict_lookup(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1568:     Pid = spawn_link(fun proc_dict_helper/0),
 1569:     {async_dist, AsyncDist} = process_info(Pid, async_dist),
 1570:     Ref = make_ref(),
 1571:     Bin = <<17:4096>>,
 1572:     Int0 = 9999999999999999999999999999999999,
 1573:     Int1 = 1111111111111111111111111111111111,
 1574:     Tuple = {make_ref(), erlang:monotonic_time()},
 1575: 
 1576:     %% Check that we can lookup dictionary values on another process...
 1577:     pdh(Pid, put_async, [hej, hopp]),
 1578:     pdh(Pid, put_async, [hopp, hej]),
 1579:     pdh(Pid, put_async, [Ref, Int0]),
 1580:     pdh(Pid, put_async, [Int0, Int1]),
 1581:     pdh(Pid, put_async, [Pid, Ref]),
 1582:     pdh(Pid, put_async, [Tuple, Bin]),
 1583:     undefined = pdh(Pid, put, [Bin, Ref]),
 1584: 
 1585:     erlang:garbage_collect(Pid),
 1586: 
 1587:     {{dictionary, Ref}, Int0} = process_info(Pid, {dictionary, Ref}),
 1588:     [{{dictionary, Ref}, Int0}] = process_info(Pid, [{dictionary, Ref}]),
 1589: 
 1590:     PIRes = process_info(Pid, [async_dist,
 1591:                                trap_exit,
 1592:                                {dictionary, hej},
 1593:                                {dictionary, hopp},
 1594:                                {dictionary, Ref},
 1595:                                {dictionary, Int0},
 1596:                                async_dist,
 1597:                                trap_exit,
 1598:                                {dictionary, Pid},
 1599:                                {dictionary, Tuple},
 1600:                                {dictionary, Bin}]),
 1601:     ct:log("PIRes = ~p", [PIRes]),
 1602:     PIRes = [{async_dist, AsyncDist},
 1603:              {trap_exit, false},
 1604:              {{dictionary, hej}, hopp},
 1605:              {{dictionary, hopp}, hej},
 1606:              {{dictionary, Ref}, Int0},
 1607:              {{dictionary, Int0}, Int1},
 1608:              {async_dist, AsyncDist},
 1609:              {trap_exit, false},
 1610:              {{dictionary, Pid}, Ref},
 1611:              {{dictionary, Tuple}, Bin},
 1612:              {{dictionary, Bin}, Ref}],
 1613: 
 1614:     pdh(Pid, erase_async, [hej]),
 1615:     pdh(Pid, erase_async, [hopp]),
 1616:     pdh(Pid, erase_async, [Ref]),
 1617:     pdh(Pid, erase_async, [Int0]),
 1618:     pdh(Pid, erase_async, [Pid]),
 1619:     pdh(Pid, erase_async, [Tuple]),
 1620:     Ref = pdh(Pid, erase, [Bin]),
 1621: 
 1622:     erlang:garbage_collect(Pid),
 1623: 
 1624:     {{dictionary, Ref}, undefined} = process_info(Pid, {dictionary, Ref}),
 1625:     [{{dictionary, Ref}, undefined}] = process_info(Pid, [{dictionary, Ref}]),
 1626: 
 1627:     PIRes2 = process_info(Pid, [async_dist,
 1628:                                 trap_exit,
 1629:                                 {dictionary, hej},
 1630:                                 {dictionary, hopp},
 1631:                                 {dictionary, Ref},
 1632:                                 {dictionary, Int0},
 1633:                                 async_dist,
 1634:                                 trap_exit,
 1635:                                 {dictionary, Pid},
 1636:                                 {dictionary, Tuple},
 1637:                                 {dictionary, Bin}]),
 1638:     ct:log("PIRes2 = ~p", [PIRes2]),
 1639: 
 1640:     PIRes2 = [{async_dist, AsyncDist},
 1641:              {trap_exit, false},
 1642:              {{dictionary, hej}, undefined},
 1643:              {{dictionary, hopp}, undefined},
 1644:              {{dictionary, Ref}, undefined},
 1645:              {{dictionary, Int0}, undefined},
 1646:              {async_dist, AsyncDist},
 1647:              {trap_exit, false},
 1648:              {{dictionary, Pid}, undefined},
 1649:              {{dictionary, Tuple}, undefined},
 1650:              {{dictionary, Bin}, undefined}],
 1651: 
 1652:     unlink(Pid),
 1653:     exit(Pid,kill),
 1654: 
 1655:     %% Also check that it works on ourself...
 1656: 
 1657:     put(hej, hopp),
 1658:     put(hopp, hej),
 1659:     put(Ref, Int0),
 1660:     put(Int0, Int1),
 1661:     put(Pid, Ref),
 1662:     put(Tuple, Bin),
 1663:     undefined = put(Bin, Ref),
 1664: 
 1665:     erlang:garbage_collect(),
 1666: 
 1667:     {{dictionary, Ref}, Int0} = process_info(self(), {dictionary, Ref}),
 1668:     [{{dictionary, Ref}, Int0}] = process_info(self(), [{dictionary, Ref}]),
 1669: 
 1670:     PIRes3 = process_info(self(), [async_dist,
 1671:                                    trap_exit,
 1672:                                    {dictionary, hej},
 1673:                                    {dictionary, hopp},
 1674:                                    {dictionary, Ref},
 1675:                                    {dictionary, Int0},
 1676:                                    async_dist,
 1677:                                    trap_exit,
 1678:                                    {dictionary, Pid},
 1679:                                    {dictionary, Tuple},
 1680:                                    {dictionary, Bin}]),
 1681:     ct:log("PIRes3 = ~p", [PIRes3]),
 1682:     PIRes3 = [{async_dist, AsyncDist},
 1683:               {trap_exit, false},
 1684:               {{dictionary, hej}, hopp},
 1685:               {{dictionary, hopp}, hej},
 1686:               {{dictionary, Ref}, Int0},
 1687:               {{dictionary, Int0}, Int1},
 1688:               {async_dist, AsyncDist},
 1689:               {trap_exit, false},
 1690:               {{dictionary, Pid}, Ref},
 1691:               {{dictionary, Tuple}, Bin},
 1692:               {{dictionary, Bin}, Ref}],
 1693: 
 1694:     erase(hej),
 1695:     erase(hopp),
 1696:     erase(Ref),
 1697:     erase(Int0),
 1698:     erase(Pid),
 1699:     erase(Tuple),
 1700:     Ref = erase(Bin),
 1701: 
 1702:     erlang:garbage_collect(),
 1703: 
 1704:     {{dictionary, Ref}, undefined} = process_info(self(), {dictionary, Ref}),
 1705:     [{{dictionary, Ref}, undefined}] = process_info(self(), [{dictionary, Ref}]),
 1706: 
 1707:     PIRes4 = process_info(self(), [async_dist,
 1708:                                    trap_exit,
 1709:                                    {dictionary, hej},
 1710:                                    {dictionary, hopp},
 1711:                                    {dictionary, Ref},
 1712:                                    {dictionary, Int0},
 1713:                                    async_dist,
 1714:                                    trap_exit,
 1715:                                    {dictionary, Pid},
 1716:                                    {dictionary, Tuple},
 1717:                                    {dictionary, Bin}]),
 1718:     ct:log("PIRes4 = ~p", [PIRes4]),
 1719: 
 1720:     PIRes4 = [{async_dist, AsyncDist},
 1721:               {trap_exit, false},
 1722:               {{dictionary, hej}, undefined},
 1723:               {{dictionary, hopp}, undefined},
 1724:               {{dictionary, Ref}, undefined},
 1725:               {{dictionary, Int0}, undefined},
 1726:               {async_dist, AsyncDist},
 1727:               {trap_exit, false},
 1728:               {{dictionary, Pid}, undefined},
 1729:               {{dictionary, Tuple}, undefined},
 1730:               {{dictionary, Bin}, undefined}],
 1731: 
 1732:     false = is_process_alive(Pid),
 1733:     ok.
 1734: 
 1735: process_info_label(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1736:     Pid = spawn_link(fun proc_dict_helper/0),
 1737:     LabelKey = '$process_label',
 1738:     Ref = make_ref(),
 1739:     Tuple = {make_ref(), erlang:monotonic_time()},
 1740: 
 1741:     undefined = pdh(Pid, put, [LabelKey, Tuple]),
 1742:     erlang:garbage_collect(Pid),
 1743: 
 1744:     {label,Tuple} = process_info(Pid, label),
 1745:     Self = self(),
 1746:     [{label,Tuple},{registered_name,[]},{links,[Self]}] =
 1747:         process_info(Pid, [label,registered_name,links]),
 1748: 
 1749:     put(LabelKey, Ref),
 1750:     {label,Ref} = process_info(self(), label),
 1751: 
 1752:     ok.
 1753: 
 1754: pdh(Pid, AsyncOp, Args) when AsyncOp == put_async;
 1755:                              AsyncOp == erase_async ->
 1756:     Pid ! {AsyncOp, Args},
 1757:     ok;
 1758: pdh(Pid, SyncOp, Args) ->
 1759:     Ref = make_ref(),
 1760:     Pid ! {SyncOp, self(), Ref, Args},
 1761:     receive {Ref, Res} -> Res end.
 1762: 
 1763: proc_dict_helper() ->
 1764:     receive
 1765:         {put, From, Ref, [Key, Value]} ->
 1766:             From ! {Ref, put(Key, Value)};
 1767:         {get, From, Ref, [Key]} ->
 1768:             From ! {Ref, get(Key)};
 1769:         {get, From, Ref, []} ->
 1770:             From ! {Ref, get()};
 1771:         {erase, From, Ref, [Key]} ->
 1772:             From ! {Ref, erase(Key)};
 1773:         {put_async, [Key, Value]} ->
 1774:             _ = put(Key, Value);
 1775:         {erase_async, [Key]} ->
 1776:             _ = erase(Key)
 1777:     end,
 1778:     proc_dict_helper().
 1779: 
 1780: %% Tests erlang:bump_reductions/1.
 1781: bump_reductions(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1782:     erlang:garbage_collect(),
 1783:     erlang:yield(),		% Clear reductions.
 1784:     {reductions,R1} = process_info(self(), reductions),
 1785:     true = erlang:bump_reductions(100),
 1786:     {reductions,R2} = process_info(self(), reductions),
 1787:     case R2-R1 of
 1788: 	      Diff when Diff < 100 ->
 1789: 		  ok = io:format("R1 = ~w, R2 = ~w", [R1, R2]),
 1790: 		  ct:fail({small_diff, Diff});
 1791: 	      Diff when Diff > 110 ->
 1792: 		  ok = io:format("R1 = ~w, R2 = ~w", [R1, R2]),
 1793: 		  ct:fail({big_diff, Diff});
 1794: 	      Diff ->
 1795: 		  io:format("~p\n", [Diff]),
 1796: 		  ok
 1797: 	  end,
 1798: 
 1799:     %% Make sure that a bignum reduction doesn't crash the emulator (32-bit CPU).
 1800:     bump_big(R2, 16#08000000).
 1801: 
 1802: bump_big(Prev, Limit) ->
 1803:     true = erlang:bump_reductions(100000), %Limited to CONTEXT_REDUCTIONS.
 1804:     case process_info(self(), reductions) of
 1805: 	      {reductions,Big} when is_integer(Big), Big > Limit ->
 1806: 		  erlang:garbage_collect(),
 1807: 		  io:format("~p\n", [Big]);
 1808: 	      {reductions,R} when is_integer(R), R > Prev ->
 1809: 		  bump_big(R, Limit)
 1810: 	  end,
 1811:     ok.
 1812: 
 1813: %% Priority 'low' should be mixed with 'normal' using a factor of
 1814: %% about 8. (OTP-2644)
 1815: low_prio(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1816:     erlang:system_flag(multi_scheduling, block_normal),
 1817:     Prop = low_prio_test(Config),
 1818:     erlang:system_flag(multi_scheduling, unblock_normal),
 1819:     Str = lists:flatten(io_lib:format("Low/high proportion is ~.3f",
 1820:                                       [Prop])),
 1821:     {comment,Str}.
 1822: 
 1823: low_prio_test(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1824:     process_flag(trap_exit, true),
 1825: 
 1826:     %% Spawn the server running with high priority. The server must
 1827:     %% not run at normal priority as that would skew the results for
 1828:     %% two reasons:
 1829:     %%
 1830:     %% 1. There would be one more normal-priority processes than
 1831:     %% low-priority processes.
 1832:     %%
 1833:     %% 2. The receive queue would grow faster than the server process
 1834:     %% could process it. That would in turn trigger the reduction
 1835:     %% punishment for the clients.
 1836:     S = spawn_opt(?MODULE, prio_server, [0, 0], [link,{priority,high}]),
 1837: 
 1838:     %% Spawn the clients and let them run for a while.
 1839:     PCs = spawn_prio_clients(S, erlang:system_info(schedulers_online)),
 1840:     ct:sleep({seconds,2}),
 1841:     lists:foreach(fun (P) -> exit(P, kill) end, PCs),
 1842: 
 1843:     %% Stop the server and retrieve the result.
 1844:     S ! exit,
 1845:     receive
 1846:         {'EXIT', S, {A, B}} ->
 1847:             check_prio(A, B)
 1848:     end.
 1849: 
 1850: check_prio(A, B) ->
 1851:     Prop = A/B,
 1852:     ok = io:format("Low=~p, High=~p, Prop=~p\n", [A, B, Prop]),
 1853: 
 1854:     %% Prop is expected to be appr. 1/8. Allow a reasonable margin.
 1855:     true = Prop < 1/4,
 1856:     true = Prop > 1/16,
 1857:     Prop.
 1858: 
 1859: prio_server(A, B) ->
 1860:     receive
 1861: 	low ->
 1862: 	    prio_server(A+1, B);
 1863: 	normal ->
 1864: 	    prio_server(A, B+1);
 1865: 	exit ->
 1866: 	    exit({A, B})
 1867:     end.
 1868: 
 1869: spawn_prio_clients(_, 0) ->
 1870:     [];
 1871: spawn_prio_clients(S, N) ->
 1872:     [spawn_opt(?MODULE, prio_client, [S, normal], [link, {priority,normal}]),
 1873:      spawn_opt(?MODULE, prio_client, [S, low], [link, {priority,low}])
 1874:      | spawn_prio_clients(S, N-1)].
 1875: 
 1876: prio_client(S, Prio) ->
 1877:     S ! Prio,
 1878:     prio_client(S, Prio).
 1879: 
 1880: make_sub_binary(Bin) when is_binary(Bin) ->
 1881:     {_,B} = split_binary(list_to_binary([0,1,3,Bin]), 3),
 1882:     B;
 1883: make_sub_binary(List) ->
 1884:     make_sub_binary(list_to_binary(List)).
 1885: 
 1886: make_unaligned_sub_binary(Bin0) ->
 1887:     Bin1 = <<0:3,Bin0/binary,31:5>>,
 1888:     Sz = size(Bin0),
 1889:     <<0:3,Bin:Sz/binary,31:5>> = id(Bin1),
 1890:     Bin.
 1891: 
 1892: %% Tests erlang:yield/1
 1893: yield(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1894:     case catch erlang:system_info(modified_timing_level) of
 1895: 	Level when is_integer(Level) ->
 1896: 	    {skipped,
 1897: 	     "Modified timing (level " ++ integer_to_list(Level)
 1898: 	     ++ ") is enabled. Testcase gets messed up by modified "
 1899: 	     "timing."};
 1900: 	_ ->
 1901: 	    MS = erlang:system_flag(multi_scheduling, block_normal),
 1902: 	    yield_test(),
 1903: 	    erlang:system_flag(multi_scheduling, unblock_normal),
 1904: 	    case MS of
 1905: 		blocked ->
 1906: 		    {comment,
 1907: 		     "Multi-scheduling blocked during test. This test-case "
 1908: 		     "was not written to work with multiple schedulers (the "
 1909: 		     "yield2 test-case tests almost the same thing)."};
 1910: 		_ ->
 1911: 		    ok
 1912: 	    end
 1913:     end.
 1914: 
 1915: yield_test() ->
 1916:     erlang:garbage_collect(),
 1917:     receive after 1 -> ok end,		% Clear reductions.
 1918:     SC = schedcnt(start),
 1919:     {reductions, R1} = process_info(self(), reductions),
 1920:     {ok, true} = call_yield(middle),
 1921:     true = call_yield(final),
 1922:     true = call_yield(),
 1923:     true = apply(erlang, yield, []),
 1924:     {reductions, R2} = process_info(self(), reductions),
 1925:     Schedcnt = schedcnt(stop, SC),
 1926:     case {R2-R1, Schedcnt} of
 1927: 	{Diff, 4} when Diff < 30 ->
 1928: 	    ok = io:format("R1 = ~w, R2 = ~w, Schedcnt = ~w", 
 1929: 		[R1, R2, Schedcnt]);
 1930: 	{Diff, _} ->
 1931: 	    ok = io:format("R1 = ~w, R2 = ~w, Schedcnt = ~w", 
 1932: 		[R1, R2, Schedcnt]),
 1933: 	    ct:fail({measurement_error, Diff, Schedcnt})
 1934:     end.
 1935: 
 1936: call_yield() ->
 1937:     erlang:yield().
 1938: 
 1939: call_yield(middle) ->
 1940:     {ok, erlang:yield()};
 1941: call_yield(final) ->
 1942:     case self() of
 1943: 	Self when is_pid(Self) ->
 1944: 	    ok
 1945:     end,
 1946:     erlang:yield().
 1947: 
 1948: schedcnt(start) ->
 1949:     Ref = make_ref(),
 1950:     Fun = 
 1951: 	fun (F, Cnt) ->
 1952: 		receive
 1953: 		    {Ref, Parent} ->
 1954: 			Parent ! {Ref, Cnt}
 1955: 		after 0 ->
 1956: 			erlang:yield(),
 1957: 			F(F, Cnt+1)
 1958: 		end
 1959: 	end,
 1960:     Pid = spawn_link(fun () -> Fun(Fun, 0) end),
 1961:     {Ref, Pid}.
 1962: 
 1963: schedcnt(stop, {Ref, Pid}) when is_reference(Ref), is_pid(Pid) ->
 1964:     Pid ! {Ref, self()},
 1965:     receive
 1966: 	{Ref, Cnt} ->
 1967: 	    Cnt
 1968:     end.
 1969: 
 1970: yield2(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1971:     Me = self(),
 1972:     Go = make_ref(),
 1973:     RedDiff = make_ref(),
 1974:     Done = make_ref(),
 1975:     P = spawn(fun () ->
 1976: 		receive Go -> ok end,
 1977: 		{reductions, R1} = process_info(self(), reductions),
 1978: 		{ok, true} = call_yield(middle),
 1979: 		true = call_yield(final),
 1980: 		true = call_yield(),
 1981: 		true = apply(erlang, yield, []),
 1982: 		{reductions, R2} = process_info(self(), reductions),
 1983: 		Me ! {RedDiff, R2 - R1},
 1984: 		exit(Done)
 1985: 	end),
 1986:     erlang:yield(),
 1987: 
 1988:     1 = erlang:trace(P, true, [running, procs, {tracer, self()}]),
 1989: 
 1990:     P ! Go,
 1991: 
 1992:     %% receive Go -> ok end,
 1993:     {trace, P, in, _} = next_tmsg(P),
 1994: 
 1995:     %% {ok, true} = call_yield(middle),
 1996:     {trace, P, out, _} = next_tmsg(P),
 1997:     {trace, P, in, _} = next_tmsg(P),
 1998: 
 1999:     %% true = call_yield(final),
 2000:     {trace, P, out, _} = next_tmsg(P),
 2001:     {trace, P, in, _} = next_tmsg(P),
 2002: 
 2003:     %% true = call_yield(),
 2004:     {trace, P, out, _} = next_tmsg(P),
 2005:     {trace, P, in, _} = next_tmsg(P),
 2006: 
 2007:     %% true = apply(erlang, yield, []),
 2008:     {trace, P, out, _} = next_tmsg(P),
 2009:     {trace, P, in, _} = next_tmsg(P),
 2010: 
 2011:     %% exit(Done)
 2012:     {trace, P, exit, Done} = next_tmsg(P),
 2013: 
 2014: 
 2015:     receive
 2016: 	      {RedDiff, Reductions} when Reductions < 30, Reductions > 0 ->
 2017: 		  io:format("Reductions = ~p~n", [Reductions]),
 2018: 		  ok;
 2019: 	      {RedDiff, Reductions} ->
 2020: 		  ct:fail({unexpected_reduction_count, Reductions})
 2021: 	  end,
 2022: 
 2023:     none = next_tmsg(P),
 2024: 
 2025:     ok.
 2026: 
 2027: next_tmsg(Pid) ->
 2028:     receive
 2029: 	TMsg when is_tuple(TMsg),
 2030: 		  element(1, TMsg) == trace,
 2031: 		  element(2, TMsg) == Pid ->
 2032: 	    TMsg
 2033:     after 100 ->
 2034: 	    none
 2035:     end.
 2036: 
 2037: dist_unlink_ack_exit_leak(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 2038:     %% Verification of nc reference counts when stopping node
 2039:     %% will find the bug if it exists...
 2040:     {ok, Peer, Node} = ?CT_PEER(),
 2041:     ParentFun =
 2042:         fun () ->
 2043:                 %% Give parent some work to do when
 2044:                 %% exiting to increase the likelyhood
 2045:                 %% of the bug triggereing...
 2046:                 T = ets:new(x,[]),
 2047:                 ets:insert(T, lists:map(fun (I) ->
 2048:                                                 {I,I}
 2049:                                         end,
 2050:                                         lists:seq(1,10000))),
 2051:                 Chld = spawn_link(Node,
 2052:                                   fun () ->
 2053:                                           receive
 2054:                                           after infinity ->
 2055:                                                   ok
 2056:                                           end
 2057:                                   end),
 2058:                 erlang:yield(),
 2059:                 unlink(Chld),
 2060:                 exit(bye)
 2061:         end,
 2062:     PMs = lists:map(fun (_) ->
 2063:                             spawn_monitor(ParentFun)
 2064:                     end, lists:seq(1, 10)),
 2065:     lists:foreach(fun ({P, M}) ->
 2066:                           receive
 2067:                               {'DOWN', M, process, P, bye} ->
 2068:                                   ok
 2069:                           end
 2070:                   end, PMs),
 2071:     stop_node(Peer, Node),
 2072:     ok.
 2073: 
 2074: %% Test that bad arguments to register/2 cause an exception.
 2075: bad_register(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 2076:     Name = a_long_and_unused_name,
 2077: 
 2078:     {'EXIT',{badarg,_}} = (catch register({bad,name}, self())),
 2079:     fail_register(undefined, self()),
 2080:     fail_register([bad,name], self()),
 2081: 
 2082:     {Dead,Mref} = spawn_monitor(fun() -> true end),
 2083:     receive
 2084: 	{'DOWN',Mref,process,Dead,_} -> ok
 2085:     end,
 2086:     fail_register(Name, Dead),
 2087:     fail_register(Name, make_ref()),
 2088:     fail_register(Name, []),
 2089:     fail_register(Name, {bad,process}),
 2090:     fail_register(Name, <<>>),
 2091:     ok.
 2092: 
 2093: fail_register(Name, Process) ->
 2094:     {'EXIT',{badarg,_}} = (catch register(Name, Process)),
 2095:     {'EXIT',{badarg,_}} = (catch Name ! anything_goes),
 2096:     ok.
 2097: 
 2098: garbage_collect(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 2099:     Prio = process_flag(priority, high),
 2100:     true = erlang:garbage_collect(),
 2101:     
 2102:     TokLoopers = lists:map(fun (_) ->
 2103: 		spawn_opt(fun tok_loop/0, [{priority, low}, link])
 2104: 	end, lists:seq(1, 10)),
 2105: 
 2106:     lists:foreach(fun (Pid) ->
 2107: 		Mon = erlang:monitor(process, Pid),
 2108: 		DownBefore = receive
 2109: 		    {'DOWN', Mon, _, _, _} ->
 2110: 			true
 2111: 		after 0 ->
 2112: 			false
 2113: 		end,
 2114: 		GC = erlang:garbage_collect(Pid),
 2115: 		DownAfter = receive
 2116: 		    {'DOWN', Mon, _, _, _} ->
 2117: 			true
 2118: 		after 0 ->
 2119: 			false
 2120: 		end,
 2121: 		true = erlang:demonitor(Mon),
 2122: 		case {DownBefore, DownAfter} of
 2123: 		    {true, _} -> false = GC;
 2124: 		    {false, false} -> true = GC;
 2125: 		    _ -> GC
 2126: 		end
 2127: 	end, processes()),
 2128: 
 2129:     lists:foreach(fun (Pid) ->
 2130: 		unlink(Pid),
 2131: 		exit(Pid, bang)
 2132: 	end, TokLoopers),
 2133:     process_flag(priority, Prio),
 2134:     ok.
 2135: 
 2136: %% This used to cause the nofrag emulator to dump core
 2137: process_info_messages(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 2138:     process_info_messages_test(),
 2139:     ok.
 2140: 
 2141: process_info_messages_loop(0) -> ok;
 2142: process_info_messages_loop(N) -> process_info_messages_loop(N-1).
 2143: 
 2144: process_info_messages_send_my_msgs_to(Rcvr) ->
 2145:     receive
 2146: 	Msg ->
 2147: 	    Rcvr ! Msg,
 2148: 	    process_info_messages_send_my_msgs_to(Rcvr)
 2149:     after 0 ->
 2150: 	    ok
 2151:     end.
 2152: 
 2153: process_info_messages_test() ->
 2154:     Go = make_ref(),
 2155:     Done = make_ref(),
 2156:     Rcvr = self(),
 2157:     Rcvr2 = spawn_link(fun () ->
 2158: 		receive {Go, Rcvr} -> ok end,
 2159: 		garbage_collect(),
 2160: 		Rcvr ! {Done, self()}
 2161: 	end),
 2162:     Sndrs = lists:map(
 2163: 	fun (_) ->
 2164: 		spawn_link(fun () ->
 2165: 			    Rcvr ! {Go, self()},
 2166: 			    receive {Go, Rcvr} -> ok end,
 2167: 			    BigData = lists:seq(1, 1000),
 2168: 			    Rcvr ! BigData,
 2169: 			    Rcvr ! BigData,
 2170: 			    Rcvr ! BigData,
 2171: 			    Rcvr ! {Done, self()}
 2172: 		    end)
 2173: 	end, lists:seq(1, 10)),
 2174:     lists:foreach(fun (Sndr) -> receive {Go, Sndr} -> ok end end,
 2175: 			Sndrs),
 2176:     garbage_collect(),
 2177:     erlang:yield(),
 2178:     lists:foreach(fun (Sndr) -> Sndr ! {Go, self()} end, Sndrs),
 2179:     process_info_messages_loop(100000000),
 2180:     Msgs = process_info(self(), messages),
 2181:     lists:foreach(fun (Sndr) -> receive {Done, Sndr} -> ok end end,
 2182: 			Sndrs),
 2183:     garbage_collect(),
 2184:     Rcvr2 ! Msgs,
 2185:     process_info_messages_send_my_msgs_to(Rcvr2),
 2186:     Rcvr2 ! {Go, self()},
 2187:     garbage_collect(),
 2188:     receive {Done, Rcvr2} -> ok end,
 2189:     Msgs.
 2190: 
 2191: chk_badarg(Fun) ->
 2192:     try Fun(), exit(no_badarg) catch error:badarg -> ok end.
 2193: 
 2194: process_flag_badarg(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 2195:     chk_badarg(fun () -> process_flag(gurka, banan) end),
 2196:     chk_badarg(fun () -> process_flag(trap_exit, gurka) end),
 2197:     chk_badarg(fun () -> process_flag(error_handler, 1) end),
 2198:     chk_badarg(fun () -> process_flag(fullsweep_after, gurka) end),
 2199:     chk_badarg(fun () -> process_flag(min_heap_size, gurka) end),
 2200:     chk_badarg(fun () -> process_flag(min_bin_vheap_size, gurka) end),
 2201:     chk_badarg(fun () -> process_flag(min_bin_vheap_size, -1) end),
 2202: 
 2203:     chk_badarg(fun () -> process_flag(max_heap_size, gurka) end),
 2204:     chk_badarg(fun () -> process_flag(max_heap_size, -1) end),
 2205:     chk_badarg(fun () ->
 2206:                        {_,Min} = process_info(self(), min_heap_size),
 2207:                        process_flag(max_heap_size, Min - 1)
 2208:                end),
 2209:     chk_badarg(fun () ->
 2210:                        {_,Min} = process_info(self(), min_heap_size),
 2211:                        process_flag(max_heap_size, #{size => Min - 1})
 2212:                end),
 2213:     chk_badarg(fun () -> process_flag(max_heap_size, #{}) end),
 2214:     chk_badarg(fun () -> process_flag(max_heap_size, #{ kill => true }) end),
 2215:     chk_badarg(fun () -> process_flag(max_heap_size, #{ size => 233,
 2216:                                                         kill => gurka }) end),
 2217:     chk_badarg(fun () -> process_flag(max_heap_size, #{ size => 233,
 2218:                                                         error_logger => gurka }) end),
 2219:     chk_badarg(fun () -> process_flag(max_heap_size, #{ size => 233,
 2220:                                                         include_shared_binaries => gurka}) end),
 2221:     chk_badarg(fun () -> process_flag(max_heap_size, #{ size => 233,
 2222:                                                         kill => true,
 2223:                                                         error_logger => gurka }) end),
 2224:     chk_badarg(fun () -> process_flag(max_heap_size, #{ size => 1 bsl 64 }) end),
 2225: 
 2226:     chk_badarg(fun () -> process_flag(priority, 4711) end),
 2227:     chk_badarg(fun () -> process_flag(save_calls, hmmm) end),
 2228:     {P,Mref} = spawn_monitor(fun () -> receive "in vain" -> no end end),
 2229:     chk_badarg(fun () -> process_flag(P, save_calls, hmmm) end),
 2230:     chk_badarg(fun () -> process_flag(gurka, save_calls, hmmm) end),
 2231:     exit(P, die),
 2232:     chk_badarg(fun () -> process_flag(P, save_calls, 0) end),
 2233:     {'DOWN', Mref, process, P, die} = receive M -> M end,
 2234:     chk_badarg(fun () -> process_flag(P, save_calls, 0) end),
 2235:     ok.
 2236: 
 2237: -include_lib("stdlib/include/ms_transform.hrl").
 2238: 
 2239: otp_6237(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 2240:     Slctrs = lists:map(fun (_) ->
 2241: 		spawn_link(fun () ->
 2242: 			    otp_6237_select_loop()
 2243: 		    end)
 2244: 	end,
 2245: 	lists:seq(1,5)),
 2246:     lists:foreach(fun (_) -> otp_6237_test() end, lists:seq(1, 100)),
 2247:     lists:foreach(fun (S) -> unlink(S),exit(S, kill) end, Slctrs), 
 2248:     ok.
 2249: 				
 2250: otp_6237_test() ->
 2251:     Parent = self(),
 2252:     Inited = make_ref(),
 2253:     Die = make_ref(),
 2254:     Pid = spawn_link(fun () ->
 2255: 		register(otp_6237,self()),
 2256: 		otp_6237 = ets:new(otp_6237,
 2257: 		    [named_table,
 2258: 			ordered_set]),
 2259: 		ets:insert(otp_6237,
 2260: 		    [{I,I}
 2261: 			|| I <- lists:seq(1, 100)]),
 2262: 		%% Inserting a lot of bif timers
 2263: 		%% increase the possibility that
 2264: 		%% the test will fail when the
 2265: 		%% original cleanup order is used
 2266: 		lists:foreach( fun (_) ->
 2267: 			    erlang:send_after(1000000, self(), {a,b,c})
 2268: 		    end, lists:seq(1,1000)),
 2269: 		Parent ! Inited,
 2270: 		receive Die -> bye end
 2271: 	end),
 2272:     receive
 2273: 	Inited -> ok
 2274:     end,
 2275:     Pid ! Die,
 2276:     otp_6237_whereis_loop().
 2277: 
 2278: otp_6237_whereis_loop() ->
 2279:     case whereis(otp_6237) of
 2280: 	      undefined ->
 2281: 		  otp_6237 = ets:new(otp_6237,
 2282: 					   [named_table,ordered_set]),
 2283: 		  ets:delete(otp_6237),
 2284: 		  ok;
 2285: 	      _ ->
 2286: 		  otp_6237_whereis_loop()
 2287: 	  end.
 2288: 	     
 2289: otp_6237_select_loop() ->
 2290:     catch ets:select(otp_6237, ets:fun2ms(fun({K, does_not_exist}) -> K end)),
 2291:     otp_6237_select_loop().
 2292: 
 2293: 
 2294: -define(NoTestProcs, 10000).
 2295: -record(ptab_list_bif_info, {min_start_reds,
 2296: 			     tab_chunks,
 2297: 			     tab_chunks_size,
 2298: 			     tab_indices_per_red,
 2299: 			     free_term_proc_reds,
 2300: 			     term_procs_per_red,
 2301: 			     term_procs_max_reds,
 2302: 			     conses_per_red,
 2303: 			     debug_level}).
 2304: 
 2305: processes_large_tab(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 2306:     sys_mem_cond_run(2048, fun () -> processes_large_tab_test() end).
 2307: 
 2308: processes_large_tab_test() ->
 2309:     enable_internal_state(),
 2310:     MaxDbgLvl = 20,
 2311:     MinProcTabSize = 2*(1 bsl 15),
 2312:     ProcTabSize0 = 1000000,
 2313:     ProcTabSize1 = case {erlang:system_info(schedulers_online),
 2314: 	    erlang:system_info(logical_processors)} of
 2315: 	{Schdlrs, Cpus} when is_integer(Cpus),
 2316: 	Schdlrs =< Cpus ->
 2317: 	    ProcTabSize0;
 2318: 	_ ->
 2319: 	    ProcTabSize0 div 4
 2320:     end,
 2321:     BT = erlang:system_info(build_type),
 2322:     ProcTabSize2 = case (BT =:= debug) or (BT =:= valgrind) of
 2323: 	true -> ProcTabSize1 - 500000;
 2324: 	false -> ProcTabSize1
 2325:     end,
 2326:     %% With high debug levels this test takes so long time that
 2327:     %% the connection times out; therefore, shrink the test on
 2328:     %% high debug levels.
 2329:     DbgLvl = case erts_debug:get_internal_state(processes_bif_info) of
 2330: 		       #ptab_list_bif_info{debug_level = Lvl} when Lvl > MaxDbgLvl ->
 2331: 			   20;
 2332: 		       #ptab_list_bif_info{debug_level = Lvl} when Lvl < 0 ->
 2333: 			   ct:fail({debug_level, Lvl});
 2334: 		       #ptab_list_bif_info{debug_level = Lvl} ->
 2335: 			   Lvl
 2336: 		   end,
 2337:     ProcTabSize3 = ProcTabSize2 - (1300000 * DbgLvl div MaxDbgLvl),
 2338:     ProcTabSize = case ProcTabSize3 < MinProcTabSize of
 2339: 			    true -> MinProcTabSize;
 2340: 			    false -> ProcTabSize3
 2341: 			end,
 2342:     {ok, Peer, LargeNode} = ?CT_PEER(["+P", integer_to_list(ProcTabSize)]),
 2343:     Res = rpc:call(LargeNode, ?MODULE, processes_bif_test, []),
 2344:     case rpc:call(LargeNode,
 2345: 			erts_debug,
 2346: 			get_internal_state,
 2347: 			[processes_bif_info]) of
 2348: 	      #ptab_list_bif_info{tab_chunks = Chunks} when is_integer(Chunks),
 2349: 							    Chunks > 1 -> ok;
 2350: 	      PBInfo -> ct:fail(PBInfo)
 2351: 	  end,
 2352:     stop_node(Peer, LargeNode),
 2353:     chk_processes_bif_test_res(Res).
 2354: 
 2355: processes_default_tab(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 2356:     sys_mem_cond_run(1024, fun () -> processes_default_tab_test() end).
 2357: 
 2358: processes_default_tab_test() ->
 2359:     {ok, Peer, DefaultNode} = ?CT_PEER(),
 2360:     Res = rpc:call(DefaultNode, ?MODULE, processes_bif_test, []),
 2361:     stop_node(Peer, DefaultNode),
 2362:     chk_processes_bif_test_res(Res).
 2363: 
 2364: processes_small_tab(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 2365:     {ok, Peer, SmallNode} = ?CT_PEER(["+P","1024"]),
 2366:     Res    = rpc:call(SmallNode, ?MODULE, processes_bif_test, []),
 2367:     PBInfo = rpc:call(SmallNode, erts_debug, get_internal_state, [processes_bif_info]),
 2368:     stop_node(Peer, SmallNode),
 2369:     true = PBInfo#ptab_list_bif_info.tab_chunks < 10,
 2370:     chk_processes_bif_test_res(Res).
 2371: 
 2372: processes_this_tab(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 2373:     Mem = case {erlang:system_info(build_type),
 2374:                 erlang:system_info(allocator)} of
 2375:               {lcnt, {_, _Vsn, [sys_alloc], _Opts}} ->
 2376:                   %% When running +Mea min + lcnt we may need more memory
 2377:                   1024 * 4;
 2378:               _ ->
 2379:                   1024
 2380:           end,
 2381:     sys_mem_cond_run(Mem, fun () -> chk_processes_bif_test_res(processes_bif_test()) end).
 2382: 
 2383: chk_processes_bif_test_res(ok) -> ok;
 2384: chk_processes_bif_test_res({comment, _} = Comment) -> Comment;
 2385: chk_processes_bif_test_res(Failure) -> ct:fail(Failure).
 2386: 
 2387: print_processes_bif_info(#ptab_list_bif_info{min_start_reds = MinStartReds,
 2388: 					     tab_chunks = TabChunks,
 2389: 					     tab_chunks_size = TabChunksSize,
 2390: 					     tab_indices_per_red = TabIndPerRed,
 2391: 					     free_term_proc_reds = FreeTPReds,
 2392: 					     term_procs_per_red = TPPerRed,
 2393: 					     term_procs_max_reds = TPMaxReds,
 2394: 					     conses_per_red = ConsesPerRed,
 2395: 					     debug_level = DbgLvl}) ->
 2396:     io:format("processes/0 bif info on node ~p:~n"
 2397: 	      "Min start reductions = ~p~n"
 2398: 	      "Process table chunks = ~p~n"
 2399: 	      "Process table chunks size = ~p~n"
 2400: 	      "Process table indices per reduction = ~p~n"
 2401: 	      "Reduction cost for free() on terminated process struct = ~p~n"
 2402: 	      "Inspect terminated processes per reduction = ~p~n"
 2403: 	      "Max reductions during inspection of terminated processes = ~p~n"
 2404: 	      "Create cons-cells per reduction = ~p~n"
 2405: 	      "Debug level = ~p~n",
 2406: 	      [node(),
 2407: 	       MinStartReds,
 2408: 	       TabChunks,
 2409: 	       TabChunksSize,
 2410: 	       TabIndPerRed,
 2411: 	       FreeTPReds,
 2412: 	       TPPerRed,
 2413: 	       TPMaxReds,
 2414: 	       ConsesPerRed,
 2415: 	       DbgLvl]).
 2416: 
 2417: processes_bif_cleaner() ->
 2418:     receive {'EXIT', _, _} -> ok end,
 2419:     processes_bif_cleaner().
 2420: 
 2421: spawn_initial_hangarounds(Cleaner) ->
 2422:     TabSz = erlang:system_info(process_limit),
 2423:     erts_debug:set_internal_state(next_pid,TabSz),
 2424:     spawn_initial_hangarounds(Cleaner,
 2425: 			      TabSz,
 2426: 			      TabSz*2,
 2427: 			      0,
 2428: 			      []).
 2429: 
 2430: processes_unexpected_result(CorrectProcs, Procs) ->
 2431:     ProcInfo = [registered_name,
 2432: 		initial_call,
 2433: 		current_function,
 2434: 		status,
 2435: 		priority],
 2436:     MissingProcs = CorrectProcs -- Procs,
 2437:     io:format("Missing processes: ~p",
 2438: 	      [lists:map(fun (Pid) ->
 2439: 				 [{pid, Pid}
 2440: 				  | case process_info(Pid, ProcInfo) of
 2441: 					undefined -> [];
 2442: 					Res -> Res
 2443: 				    end]
 2444: 			 end,
 2445: 			 MissingProcs)]),
 2446:     SuperfluousProcs = Procs -- CorrectProcs,
 2447:     io:format("Superfluous processes: ~p",
 2448: 	      [lists:map(fun (Pid) ->
 2449: 				 [{pid, Pid}
 2450: 				  | case process_info(Pid, ProcInfo) of
 2451: 					undefined -> [];
 2452: 					Res -> Res
 2453: 				    end]
 2454: 			 end,
 2455: 			 SuperfluousProcs)]),
 2456:     ct:fail(unexpected_result).
 2457: 
 2458: hangaround(Cleaner, Type) ->
 2459:     %% Type is only used to distinguish different processes from
 2460:     %% when doing process_info
 2461:     try link(Cleaner) catch error:Reason -> exit(Reason) end,
 2462:     receive after infinity -> ok end,
 2463:     exit(Type).
 2464: 
 2465: spawn_initial_hangarounds(_Cleaner, NP, Max, Len, HAs) when NP > Max ->
 2466:     {Len, HAs};
 2467: spawn_initial_hangarounds(Cleaner, NP, Max, Len, HAs) ->
 2468:     Skip = 30,
 2469:     wait_for_proc_slots(Skip+3),
 2470:     HA1 = spawn_opt(?MODULE, hangaround, [Cleaner, initial_hangaround],
 2471: 		    [{priority, low}]),
 2472:     HA2 = spawn_opt(?MODULE, hangaround, [Cleaner, initial_hangaround],
 2473: 		    [{priority, normal}]),
 2474:     HA3 = spawn_opt(?MODULE, hangaround, [Cleaner, initial_hangaround],
 2475: 		    [{priority, high}]),
 2476:     spawn_drop(Skip),
 2477:     spawn_initial_hangarounds(Cleaner, NP+Skip, Max, Len+3, [HA1,HA2,HA3|HAs]).
 2478: 
 2479: wait_for_proc_slots(MinFreeSlots) ->
 2480:     case erlang:system_info(process_limit) - erlang:system_info(process_count) of
 2481:         FreeSlots when FreeSlots < MinFreeSlots ->
 2482:             receive after 10 -> ok end,
 2483:             wait_for_proc_slots(MinFreeSlots);
 2484:         _FreeSlots ->
 2485:             ok
 2486:     end.
 2487: 
 2488: spawn_drop(N) when N =< 0 ->
 2489:     ok;
 2490: spawn_drop(N) ->
 2491:     spawn(fun () -> ok end),
 2492:     spawn_drop(N-1).
 2493: 
 2494: do_processes(WantReds) ->
 2495:     erts_debug:set_internal_state(reds_left, WantReds),
 2496:     processes().
 2497: 
 2498: processes_bif_test() ->
 2499:     Tester = self(),
 2500:     enable_internal_state(),
 2501:     PBInfo = erts_debug:get_internal_state(processes_bif_info),
 2502:     print_processes_bif_info(PBInfo),
 2503:     WantReds = PBInfo#ptab_list_bif_info.min_start_reds + 10,
 2504:     WillTrap = case PBInfo of
 2505: 	#ptab_list_bif_info{tab_chunks = Chunks} when Chunks < 10 ->
 2506: 	    false; %% Skip for small tables
 2507: 	#ptab_list_bif_info{tab_chunks = Chunks,
 2508: 	    tab_chunks_size = ChunksSize,
 2509: 	    tab_indices_per_red = IndiciesPerRed
 2510: 	} ->
 2511: 	    Chunks*ChunksSize >= IndiciesPerRed*WantReds
 2512:     end,
 2513:     Processes = fun () ->
 2514: 	    erts_debug:set_internal_state(reds_left,WantReds),
 2515: 	    processes()
 2516:     end,
 2517: 
 2518:     IterProcesses =
 2519:         fun () ->
 2520:                 erts_debug:set_internal_state(reds_left, WantReds),
 2521:                 iter_all_processes()
 2522:         end,
 2523: 
 2524:     ok = do_processes_bif_test(WantReds, WillTrap, Processes),
 2525:     ok = do_processes_bif_test(WantReds, false, IterProcesses()),
 2526: 
 2527:     case WillTrap of
 2528: 	false ->
 2529: 	    ok;
 2530: 	true ->
 2531: 	    %% Do it against with a process suspended while
 2532: 	    %% in the processes/0 bif.
 2533: 	    erlang:system_flag(multi_scheduling, block_normal),
 2534: 	    Suspendee = spawn_link(fun () ->
 2535: 						 Tester ! {suspend_me, self()},
 2536: 						 Tester ! {self(),
 2537: 							   done,
 2538: 							   hd(Processes())},
 2539: 						 receive
 2540: 						 after infinity ->
 2541: 							 ok
 2542: 						 end
 2543: 					 end),
 2544: 	    receive {suspend_me, Suspendee} -> ok end,
 2545: 	    erlang:suspend_process(Suspendee),
 2546: 	    erlang:system_flag(multi_scheduling, unblock_normal),
 2547: 	    
 2548: 	    [{status,suspended},{current_function,{erlang,ptab_list_continue,2}}] =
 2549: 		process_info(Suspendee, [status, current_function]),
 2550: 
 2551: 	    ok = do_processes_bif_test(WantReds, WillTrap, Processes),
 2552: 	    
 2553: 	    erlang:resume_process(Suspendee),
 2554: 	    receive {Suspendee, done, _} -> ok end,
 2555: 	    unlink(Suspendee),
 2556: 	    exit(Suspendee, bang)
 2557:     end,
 2558:     case get(processes_bif_testcase_comment) of
 2559: 	undefined -> ok;
 2560: 	Comment -> {comment, Comment}
 2561:     end.
 2562: 
 2563: iter_all_processes() ->
 2564:     Iter = erlang:processes_iterator(),
 2565:     iter_all_processes(Iter).
 2566: 
 2567: iter_all_processes(Iter0) ->
 2568:     case erlang:processes_next(Iter0) of
 2569:         {Pid, Iter} ->
 2570:             [Pid|iter_all_processes(Iter)];
 2571:         none ->
 2572:             none
 2573:     end.
 2574: 
 2575: do_processes_bif_test(WantReds, DieTest, Processes) ->
 2576:     Tester = self(),
 2577:     SpawnProcesses = fun (Prio) ->
 2578: 	    spawn_opt(?MODULE, do_processes, [WantReds], [link, {priority, Prio}])
 2579:     end,
 2580:     Cleaner = spawn_link(fun () ->
 2581: 		process_flag(trap_exit, true),
 2582: 		Tester ! {cleaner_alive, self()},
 2583: 		processes_bif_cleaner()
 2584: 	end),
 2585:     receive {cleaner_alive, Cleaner} -> ok end,
 2586:     try
 2587: 	DoIt = make_ref(),
 2588: 	GetGoing = make_ref(),
 2589: 	{NoTestProcs, TestProcs} = spawn_initial_hangarounds(Cleaner),
 2590: 	io:format("Testing with ~p processes~n", [NoTestProcs]),
 2591: 	SpawnHangAround = fun () ->
 2592: 		spawn(?MODULE, hangaround, [Cleaner, new_hangaround])
 2593: 	end,
 2594: 	Killer = spawn_opt(fun () ->
 2595: 		    Splt = NoTestProcs div 10,
 2596: 		    {TP1, TP23} = lists:split(Splt, TestProcs),
 2597: 		    {TP2, TP3} = lists:split(Splt, TP23),
 2598: 		    erlang:system_flag(multi_scheduling, block_normal),
 2599: 		    Tester ! DoIt,
 2600: 		    receive GetGoing -> ok end,
 2601: 		    erlang:system_flag(multi_scheduling, unblock_normal),
 2602: 		    SpawnProcesses(high),
 2603: 		    lists:foreach( fun (P) ->
 2604: 				SpawnHangAround(),
 2605: 				exit(P, bang)
 2606: 			end, TP1),
 2607: 		    SpawnProcesses(high),
 2608: 		    erlang:yield(),
 2609: 		    lists:foreach( fun (P) ->
 2610: 				SpawnHangAround(),
 2611: 				exit(P, bang)
 2612: 			end, TP2),
 2613: 		    SpawnProcesses(high),
 2614: 		    lists:foreach(
 2615: 			fun (P) ->
 2616: 				SpawnHangAround(),
 2617: 				exit(P, bang)
 2618: 			end, TP3)
 2619: 	    end, [{priority, high}, link]),
 2620: 	receive DoIt -> ok end,
 2621: 	process_flag(priority, low),
 2622: 	SpawnProcesses(low),
 2623: 	erlang:yield(),
 2624: 	process_flag(priority, normal),
 2625: 	CorrectProcs0 = erts_debug:get_internal_state(processes),
 2626: 	Killer ! GetGoing,
 2627: 	erts_debug:set_internal_state(reds_left, WantReds),
 2628: 	Procs0 = processes(),
 2629: 	Procs = lists:sort(Procs0),
 2630: 	CorrectProcs = lists:sort(CorrectProcs0),
 2631: 	LengthCorrectProcs = length(CorrectProcs),
 2632: 	io:format("~p = length(CorrectProcs)~n", [LengthCorrectProcs]),
 2633: 	true = LengthCorrectProcs > NoTestProcs,
 2634: 	case CorrectProcs =:= Procs of
 2635: 	    true ->
 2636: 		ok;
 2637: 	    false ->
 2638: 		processes_unexpected_result(CorrectProcs, Procs)
 2639: 	end,
 2640: 	unlink(Killer),
 2641: 	exit(Killer, bang)
 2642:     after
 2643: 	unlink(Cleaner),
 2644:         exit(Cleaner, kill),
 2645:         %% Wait for the system to recover to a normal state...
 2646: 	wait_until_system_recover()
 2647:     end,
 2648:     do_processes_bif_die_test(DieTest, Processes),
 2649:     ok.
 2650: 
 2651: 
 2652: do_processes_bif_die_test(false, _Processes) ->
 2653:     io:format("Skipping test killing process executing processes/0~n",[]),
 2654:     ok;
 2655: do_processes_bif_die_test(true, Processes) ->
 2656:     do_processes_bif_die_test(5, Processes);
 2657: do_processes_bif_die_test(N, Processes) ->
 2658:     io:format("Doing test killing process executing processes/0~n",[]),
 2659:     try
 2660: 	Tester = self(),
 2661: 	Oooh_Nooooooo = make_ref(),
 2662: 	{_, DieWhileDoingMon} = erlang:spawn_monitor( fun () ->
 2663: 		    Victim = self(),
 2664: 		    spawn_opt(
 2665: 			fun () ->
 2666: 				exit(Victim, got_him)
 2667: 			end,
 2668: 			[link, {priority, max}]),
 2669: 		    Tester ! {Oooh_Nooooooo,
 2670: 			hd(Processes())},
 2671: 		    exit(ohhhh_nooooo)
 2672: 	    end),
 2673: 	receive
 2674: 	    {'DOWN', DieWhileDoingMon, _, _, Reason} ->
 2675: 		case Reason of
 2676: 		    got_him -> ok;
 2677: 		    _ -> throw({kill_in_trap, Reason})
 2678: 		end
 2679: 	end,
 2680: 	receive
 2681: 	    {Oooh_Nooooooo, _} ->
 2682: 		throw({kill_in_trap, 'Oooh_Nooooooo'})
 2683: 	after 0 ->
 2684: 		ok
 2685: 	end,
 2686: 	PrcsCllrsSeqLen = 2*erlang:system_info(schedulers_online),
 2687: 	PrcsCllrsSeq = lists:seq(1, PrcsCllrsSeqLen),
 2688: 	ProcsCallers = lists:map( fun (_) ->
 2689: 		    spawn_link(
 2690: 			fun () ->
 2691: 				Tester ! hd(Processes())
 2692: 			end)
 2693: 	    end, PrcsCllrsSeq),
 2694: 	erlang:yield(),
 2695: 	{ProcsCallers1, ProcsCallers2} = lists:split(PrcsCllrsSeqLen div 2,
 2696: 						     ProcsCallers),
 2697: 	process_flag(priority, high),
 2698: 	lists:foreach(
 2699: 		fun (P) ->
 2700: 			unlink(P),
 2701: 			exit(P, bang)
 2702: 		end,
 2703: 		lists:reverse(ProcsCallers2) ++ ProcsCallers1),
 2704: 	process_flag(priority, normal),
 2705: 	ok
 2706:     catch
 2707: 	throw:{kill_in_trap, R} when N > 0 ->
 2708: 	    io:format("Failed to kill in trap: ~p~n", [R]),
 2709: 	    io:format("Trying again~n", []),
 2710: 	    do_processes_bif_die_test(N-1, Processes)
 2711:     end.
 2712: 	    
 2713: 
 2714: wait_until_system_recover() ->
 2715:     %% If system hasn't recovered after 10 seconds we give up
 2716:     Tmr = erlang:start_timer(10000, self(), no_more_wait),
 2717:     wait_until_system_recover(Tmr).
 2718: 
 2719: wait_until_system_recover(Tmr) ->
 2720:     try
 2721: 	lists:foreach(fun (P) when P == self() ->
 2722: 			      ok;
 2723: 			  (P) ->
 2724: 			      case process_info(P, initial_call) of
 2725: 				  {initial_call,{?MODULE, _, _}} ->
 2726: 				      throw(wait);
 2727: 				  {initial_call,{_, _, _}} ->
 2728: 				      ok;
 2729: 				  undefined ->
 2730: 				      ok
 2731: 			      end
 2732: 		      end,
 2733: 		      processes())
 2734:     catch
 2735: 	throw:wait ->
 2736: 	    receive
 2737: 		{timeout, Tmr, _} ->
 2738: 		    Comment = "WARNING: Test processes still hanging around!",
 2739: 		    io:format("~s~n", [Comment]),
 2740: 		    put(processes_bif_testcase_comment, Comment),
 2741: 		    lists:foreach(
 2742: 		      fun (P) when P == self() ->
 2743: 			      ok;
 2744: 			  (P) ->
 2745: 			      case process_info(P, initial_call) of
 2746: 				  {initial_call,{?MODULE, _, _} = MFA} ->
 2747: 				      io:format("~p ~p~n", [P, MFA]);
 2748: 				  {initial_call,{_, _, _}} ->
 2749: 				      ok;
 2750: 				  undefined ->
 2751: 				      ok
 2752: 			      end
 2753: 		      end,
 2754: 		      processes())
 2755: 	    after 100 ->
 2756: 		    wait_until_system_recover(Tmr)
 2757: 	    end
 2758:     end,
 2759:     erlang:cancel_timer(Tmr),
 2760:     receive {timeout, Tmr, _} -> ok after 0 -> ok end,
 2761:     ok.
 2762: 
 2763: processes_last_call_trap(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 2764:     enable_internal_state(),
 2765:     Processes = fun () -> processes() end,
 2766:     PBInfo = erts_debug:get_internal_state(processes_bif_info),
 2767:     print_processes_bif_info(PBInfo),
 2768:     WantReds = case PBInfo#ptab_list_bif_info.min_start_reds of
 2769: 	R when R > 10 -> R - 1;
 2770: 	_R -> 9
 2771:     end,
 2772:     lists:foreach(fun (_) ->
 2773: 		erts_debug:set_internal_state(reds_left,
 2774: 		    WantReds),
 2775: 		Processes(),
 2776: 		erts_debug:set_internal_state(reds_left,
 2777: 		    WantReds),
 2778: 		my_processes()
 2779: 	end,
 2780: 	lists:seq(1,100)).
 2781:     
 2782: my_processes() ->
 2783:     processes().
 2784: 
 2785: processes_apply_trap(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 2786:     enable_internal_state(),
 2787:     PBInfo = erts_debug:get_internal_state(processes_bif_info),
 2788:     print_processes_bif_info(PBInfo),
 2789:     WantReds = case PBInfo#ptab_list_bif_info.min_start_reds of
 2790: 	R when R > 10 -> R - 1;
 2791: 	_R -> 9
 2792:     end,
 2793:     lists:foreach(fun (_) ->
 2794: 		erts_debug:set_internal_state(reds_left,
 2795: 		    WantReds),
 2796: 		apply(erlang, processes, [])
 2797: 	end, lists:seq(1,100)).
 2798: 
 2799: processes_gc_trap(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 2800:     Tester = self(),
 2801:     enable_internal_state(),
 2802:     PBInfo = erts_debug:get_internal_state(processes_bif_info),
 2803:     print_processes_bif_info(PBInfo),
 2804:     WantReds = PBInfo#ptab_list_bif_info.min_start_reds + 10,
 2805:     Processes = fun () ->
 2806: 	    erts_debug:set_internal_state(reds_left,WantReds),
 2807: 	    processes()
 2808:     end,
 2809: 
 2810:     erlang:system_flag(multi_scheduling, block_normal),
 2811:     Suspendee = spawn_link(fun () ->
 2812: 					 Tester ! {suspend_me, self()},
 2813: 					 Tester ! {self(),
 2814: 						   done,
 2815: 						   hd(Processes())},
 2816: 					 receive after infinity -> ok end
 2817: 				 end),
 2818:     receive {suspend_me, Suspendee} -> ok end,
 2819:     erlang:suspend_process(Suspendee),
 2820:     erlang:system_flag(multi_scheduling, unblock_normal),
 2821: 	    
 2822:     [{status,suspended}, {current_function,{erlang,ptab_list_continue,2}}]
 2823: 	= process_info(Suspendee, [status, current_function]),
 2824: 
 2825:     erlang:garbage_collect(Suspendee),
 2826:     erlang:garbage_collect(Suspendee),
 2827: 	    
 2828:     erlang:resume_process(Suspendee),
 2829:     receive {Suspendee, done, _} -> ok end,
 2830:     erlang:garbage_collect(Suspendee),
 2831:     erlang:garbage_collect(Suspendee),
 2832: 
 2833:     unlink(Suspendee),
 2834:     exit(Suspendee, bang),
 2835:     ok.
 2836: 
 2837: process_flag_fullsweep_after(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 2838:     {fullsweep_after, OldFSA} = process_info(self(), fullsweep_after),
 2839:     OldFSA = process_flag(fullsweep_after, 12345),
 2840:     {fullsweep_after, 12345} = process_info(self(), fullsweep_after),
 2841:     12345 = process_flag(fullsweep_after, 0),
 2842:     {fullsweep_after, 0} = process_info(self(), fullsweep_after),
 2843:     0 = process_flag(fullsweep_after, OldFSA),
 2844:     ok.
 2845: 
 2846: process_flag_heap_size(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 2847:     HSize  = 2586,   % must be gc fib+ number
 2848:     VHSize = 318187, % must be gc fib+ number
 2849:     OldHmin = erlang:process_flag(min_heap_size, HSize),
 2850:     {min_heap_size, HSize} = erlang:process_info(self(), min_heap_size),
 2851:     OldVHmin = erlang:process_flag(min_bin_vheap_size, VHSize),
 2852:     {min_bin_vheap_size, VHSize} = erlang:process_info(self(), min_bin_vheap_size),
 2853:     HSize = erlang:process_flag(min_heap_size, OldHmin),
 2854:     VHSize = erlang:process_flag(min_bin_vheap_size, OldVHmin),
 2855:     ok.
 2856: 
 2857: %% test that max_heap_size is correctly handled when passed via command line
 2858: command_line_max_heap_size(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 2859:     %% test maximum heap size
 2860:     HMax = case erlang:system_info(wordsize) of
 2861:                8 -> (1 bsl 59) - 1;
 2862:                4 -> (1 bsl 27) - 1
 2863:            end,
 2864:     {ok, Peer, Node} = ?CT_PEER(["+hmax", integer_to_list(HMax)]),
 2865:     Pid = erlang:spawn(Node, fun () -> receive after infinity -> ok end end),
 2866:     {max_heap_size, #{size := HMax}} = rpc:call(Node, erlang, process_info, [Pid, max_heap_size]),
 2867:     peer:stop(Peer).
 2868: 
 2869: spawn_opt_heap_size(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 2870:     HSize  = 987,   % must be gc fib+ number
 2871:     VHSize = 46422, % must be gc fib+ number
 2872:     Pid  = spawn_opt(fun () -> receive stop -> ok end end,
 2873: 	[{min_heap_size, HSize},{ min_bin_vheap_size, VHSize}]),
 2874:     {min_heap_size, HSize} = process_info(Pid, min_heap_size),
 2875:     {min_bin_vheap_size, VHSize} = process_info(Pid, min_bin_vheap_size),
 2876:     Pid ! stop,
 2877:     ok.
 2878: 
 2879: spawn_opt_max_heap_size(_Config) ->
 2880: 
 2881:     error_logger:add_report_handler(?MODULE, self()),
 2882: 
 2883:     %% flush any prior messages in error_logger
 2884:     Pid = spawn(fun() -> ok = nok end),
 2885:     receive
 2886:         {error, _, {emulator, _, [Pid|_]}} ->
 2887:             flush()
 2888:     end,
 2889: 
 2890:     spawn_opt_max_heap_size_do(fun oom_fun/1),
 2891: 
 2892:     io:format("Repeat tests with refc binaries\n",[]),
 2893: 
 2894:     spawn_opt_max_heap_size_do(fun oom_bin_fun/1),
 2895: 
 2896:     error_logger:delete_report_handler(?MODULE),
 2897:     ok.
 2898: 
 2899: spawn_opt_max_heap_size_do(OomFun) ->
 2900:     Max = 2024,
 2901:     %% Test that numerical limit works
 2902:     max_heap_size_test(Max, Max, true, true, OomFun),
 2903: 
 2904:     %% Test that map limit works
 2905:     max_heap_size_test(#{ size => Max }, Max, true, true, OomFun),
 2906: 
 2907:     %% Test that no kill is sent
 2908:     max_heap_size_test(#{ size => Max, kill => false }, Max, false, true, OomFun),
 2909: 
 2910:     %% Test that no error_logger report is sent
 2911:     max_heap_size_test(#{ size => Max, error_logger => false }, Max, true, false, OomFun),
 2912: 
 2913:     %% Test that system_flag works
 2914:     erlang:system_flag(max_heap_size, OomFun(#{ size => 0, kill => false,
 2915:                                                 error_logger => true})),
 2916:     max_heap_size_test(#{ size => Max }, Max, false, true, OomFun),
 2917:     max_heap_size_test(#{ size => Max, kill => true }, Max, true, true, OomFun),
 2918: 
 2919:     erlang:system_flag(max_heap_size, OomFun(#{ size => 0, kill => true,
 2920:                                                 error_logger => false})),
 2921:     max_heap_size_test(#{ size => Max }, Max, true, false, OomFun),
 2922:     max_heap_size_test(#{ size => Max, error_logger => true }, Max, true, true, OomFun),
 2923: 
 2924:     erlang:system_flag(max_heap_size, OomFun(#{ size => 1 bsl 16, kill => true,
 2925:                                                 error_logger => true})),
 2926:     max_heap_size_test(#{ }, 1 bsl 16, true, true, OomFun),
 2927: 
 2928:     erlang:system_flag(max_heap_size, #{ size => 0, kill => true,
 2929:                                          error_logger => true}),
 2930: 
 2931:     %% Test that ordinary case works as expected again
 2932:     max_heap_size_test(Max, Max, true, true, OomFun),
 2933:     ok.
 2934: 
 2935: 
 2936: mhs_spawn_opt(Option) when map_get(size, Option) > 0;
 2937:                            is_integer(Option) ->
 2938:     [{max_heap_size, Option}];
 2939: mhs_spawn_opt(_) ->
 2940:     [].
 2941: 
 2942: max_heap_size_test(Option, Size, Kill, ErrorLogger, OomFun) ->
 2943:     SpOpt = mhs_spawn_opt(OomFun(Option)),
 2944:     Pid = spawn_opt(fun()-> OomFun(run) end, SpOpt),
 2945:     {max_heap_size, MHSz} = erlang:process_info(Pid, max_heap_size),
 2946:     ct:log("Default: ~p~nOption: ~p~nProc: ~p~nSize = ~p~nSpOpt = ~p~n",
 2947:            [erlang:system_info(max_heap_size), Option, MHSz, Size, SpOpt]),
 2948: 
 2949:     #{ size := Size} = MHSz,
 2950: 
 2951:     Ref = erlang:monitor(process, Pid),
 2952:     if Kill ->
 2953:             receive
 2954:                 {'DOWN', Ref, process, Pid, Reason} ->
 2955:                     killed = Reason
 2956:             end;
 2957:        true ->
 2958:             ok
 2959:     end,
 2960:     if ErrorLogger ->
 2961:             receive
 2962:                 %% There must be at least one error message.
 2963:                 {error, _, {emulator, _, [Pid|_]}} ->
 2964:                     ok
 2965:             end;
 2966:        true ->
 2967:             ok
 2968:     end,
 2969:     if not Kill ->
 2970:             exit(Pid, die),
 2971:             receive
 2972:                 {'DOWN', Ref, process, Pid, die} ->
 2973:                     ok
 2974:             end,
 2975:             %% If the process was not killed, the limit may have
 2976:             %% been reached more than once and there may be
 2977:             %% more {error, ...} messages left.
 2978:             receive_error_messages(Pid);
 2979:        true ->
 2980:             ok
 2981:     end,
 2982: 
 2983:     %% Make sure that there are no unexpected messages.
 2984:     receive_unexpected().
 2985: 
 2986: oom_fun(Max) when is_integer(Max) -> Max;
 2987: oom_fun(Map) when is_map(Map)-> Map;
 2988: oom_fun(run) ->
 2989:     io:format("oom_fun() started\n",[]),
 2990:     oom_run_fun([], 100).
 2991: 
 2992: oom_run_fun(Acc0, 0) ->
 2993:     done;
 2994: oom_run_fun(Acc0, N) ->
 2995:     %% This is tail-recursive since the compiler is smart enough to figure
 2996:     %% out that a body-recursive variant never returns, and loops forever
 2997:     %% without keeping the list alive.
 2998:     timer:sleep(5),
 2999:     oom_run_fun([lists:seq(1, 1000) | Acc0], N-1).
 3000: 
 3001: oom_bin_fun(Max) when is_integer(Max) -> oom_bin_fun(#{size => Max});
 3002: oom_bin_fun(Map) when is_map(Map) -> Map#{include_shared_binaries => true};
 3003: oom_bin_fun(run) ->
 3004:     oom_bin_run_fun([], 10).
 3005: 
 3006: oom_bin_run_fun(Acc0, 0) ->
 3007:     done;
 3008: oom_bin_run_fun(Acc0, N) ->
 3009:     timer:sleep(5),
 3010:     oom_bin_run_fun([build_refc_bin(160, <<>>) | Acc0], N-1).
 3011: 
 3012: build_refc_bin(0, Acc) ->
 3013:     Acc;
 3014: build_refc_bin(N, Acc) ->
 3015:     build_refc_bin(N-1, <<Acc/binary, 0:(1000*8)>>).
 3016: 
 3017: 
 3018: receive_error_messages(Pid) ->
 3019:     receive
 3020:         {error, _, {emulator, _, [Pid|_]}} ->
 3021:             receive_error_messages(Pid)
 3022:     after 1000 ->
 3023:             ok
 3024:     end.
 3025: 
 3026: receive_unexpected() ->
 3027:     receive
 3028:         {info_report, _, _} ->
 3029:             %% May be an alarm message from os_mon. Ignore.
 3030:             receive_unexpected();
 3031:         M ->
 3032:             ct:fail({unexpected_message, M})
 3033:     after 10 ->
 3034:             ok
 3035:     end.
 3036: 
 3037: flush() ->
 3038:     receive
 3039:         _M -> flush()
 3040:     after 0 ->
 3041:             ok
 3042:     end.
 3043: 
 3044: %% error_logger report handler proxy
 3045: init(Pid) ->
 3046:     {ok, Pid}.
 3047: 
 3048: handle_event(Event, Pid) ->
 3049:     Pid ! Event,
 3050:     {ok, Pid}.
 3051:
